I am going to write a review based on my experience with the PS4 version. Basically this game does have a lot of negative reviews but it's mostly surrounding the Campaign and Multiplayer. As for most COD games, this is rather the norm. My advice to any serious COD player is to just play the Zombies mode, which in my honest opinion offers far more value than the Campaign and Multiplayer. Zombies is a whole other game in itself, and it should be played as a separate game entirely. If you play the Zombies in Spaceland, and Rave in the Redwoods, suddenly Infinite Warfare doesn't seem so bad. Guess why? Because it was ripped off from the Treyarch Games, that do so well in both gameplay, and revenue. So, basically it's from an entire developer entirely in terms of spirit and idea. Play Zombies, stick to zombies, fight against a common enemy, and you won't be disappointed. Playing COD for the campaign is like watching porn for the plot.

not sure what everyone's issue is with this game, but i love it! one up for me.
As playing it on PC and Xbox, this game is a well built game, yes there is some major/minor flaws, but overall, if you take the time and effort into looking at what this game has to offer, you'd be blown away. The campaign is amazing, had a very fun time playing it and it's repeatable, you have side missions and the ability to go stealth or loud, the story overall was amazing. Replayability is somewhat okay, afterall you have +2 dificulties to use.The multiplayer however is fairly decent, you can tell the devs didn't put time and effort into some of the stuff, for example, when you put the foregrip on the R3K, you'll see it's identical to the normal grip. Varients of the guns are pretty good, they are simmilar to IW, but mostly has positive effects. Supply Drops aren't the most perfect thing, but the stuff infinity ward had to offer was overall good such as camos and rig customization. And overall gameplay is pretty good, not many people like chain-based movement but i'm a fan of it, not saying i'd like it to return in cod 2017, but a really good concept.Finally, zombies. I didn't play much of zombies because i'm waiting on the new map pack, but it has a pretty good storyline, the movie based theme to it wonders where you'll go next in the story, having been to the 80's and 90's, maybe they'll bring it to the 60's or where the campaign/multiplayer time period is. It's replayability isn't the best, but still fun.Overall rating 8/10, the game could use some work, but as i said before, it's a well built game, do I recomend it, only to some people if they like this game. Loved the game, it shouldn't get as much hate as it does.

Zombies Hella fun everything else = trash.
Okay so I am going against the norm here but I really enjoyed this game. Heres what I liked about itA. Supply drop system, Yes I know I am the devil incarnate for liking this system but here me out first. What I like about it is the crafting system, it essentailly lets you make what you want from drops. While this doesnt include taunts or gestures or customizations for guns it does include the really important part of the drops, variants. You get to craft these in a sort of crafting tree, I crafted the Ripper after 4 hours of gameplay, not only this variants have some really interesting ablilites that actually change the whole guns behavior making it a whole new gun.B. Gameplay this is a bad and a good but ill get on the bad later. Atleast during my time on the game the enhanced movement felt fluid and easy to use. I could esailly boost around the map and outmanouver my target confusing them and letting me get an easy kill of course some people complain about this but when you are using the duelist class,which is just two G18s, its essentail to outmanouver a target or they will shoot and kill you before you even have a chance to hit them.C. Weapons, wow I love most of the weapons ive used so far. Some guns like the Reaver or NV4 really tick me off jsut because they are so boring in terms of gameplay. But other ones like the Type2 and the Banshee are really cool in my opinion. Example the Type2 is an assualt rifle that can convert into akimbo pistols for close range combat. This means I dont need two weapons for close quarters I can just use this one and focus on perks or attacments. It doesnt have too high of a damage while in pistol form but there is just something so cool about shooting lasers from dual pistols to me. The richochet on some of the laser guns with attachments makes it easier to take out campers in corners without jeopardising yourself. Now for the things I dont likeA. Guns, Alright like i said before some guns just really tick me off such as the NV4. The Reaver shot gun is essentailly the brecci from Black ops 3 literally almost a copy paste. The differences being it doesnt kill as consitantly as the brecci but it shoots much faster and can be a one hit from point blank unlike the brecci regardless of headshot or bodyshot. Varients that have a custom glowing camo, this really irks me A. Its ugly B. It gives you away if your trying to hide behind cover due to it glowing pretty brightly. And C its only available in supply drops which is stupid. The NV4 is dumb as well not only is it the first Assult rifle you get is nothing more than just a fullauto rilfe, no cool conversion mechanic, no cool attament, nothing new just a plain old assualt rifle. Consistanly kills in 4 hits but can kill in one headshot meaning if a level one sprays it at you your dead no matter what especially in close quaters due to its really tight spread. I found this especially annoying when using the Type2 as it doesnt kill as fast meaning I would either have to be lucky and ambush them or hope they had♥♥♥♥♥♥♥aim.B. Lag, its not as bad as people say it is, atleast for me, but it seems everytime someone joins or talks on the mic it lags the whole game which is stupid. Secondly if someon pulls out something like the steel dragon, the payload or specialist weapon for the merk class, it lags for some reason and if someone is shooting a very high rate of fire gun it lags. I dont know why this happens but it does and it sucks.C. People, alirght this isnt a game issue but people can be really salty on this game. Withen two hours I have 5 people ♥♥♥♥♥ about how i was using the Banshee, an pump action soundwave? shot gun that has a very high range drop off. Then I had people ♥♥♥♥♥ at me for using the Type 2 another realitvly hard to use gun due to its low damage output especially when in akimbo mode. Really its stupid to complain aobut someone for using a gun they like I didnt complain aobut people using the reaver or NV4 while I was playing and those guns really are annoying at times Anyway thanks for reading I would perfer for people to not say im stupid for liking this game because lets face it like black ops 3 its a solid fun at times game its just not a good COD game if they want to keep making Cods like this name it something else and pass it off as a new game series and change things up a bit while giving COD back its good old boots on the ground feel thats my opinion anyway cheers.

No♥♥♥♥♥♥Sherlock, I know, but I really mean it.I was a bit held back by buying this game, even tho i had to pay only about 12$ for it,  , at least for me.I know that i'm gonna get some dislikes and hate on this review because it's a positive one- but hear me out on this: This game is not perfect. But i really like it. Why would i like such a bad game? Well, let me explain:1.  It's simply the best CoD campaign ever for me. Really fun, set in space, and i love space, pretty well developed characters, awesome ending and the ''after my death'' recording for every character really make you sorry for them dying, or feel them in some way.2.  Those are some of the most original weapon in a game, ever. Other games? Firerate, acurracy, recoil and damage. Here? Oh boy- You have a weapon that hipfires very well, but has a low firerate. Once you ADS, that firerate almost doubles. You have an SMG with an horizontal crosshair and spread. You have an assault rifle that splits in two and becomes two SMG's that destroy at close rage. An assault rifle that splits in two and becomes a melle weapon. Do i need to say more?3.  Some people say they look bad. That's not true if you don't compare it to BF1 on ultra. They look really good, and the color scheme is really good too! Looks like a colorful Ghosts, really enjoy it.4.  You can chose one of 6 specialists, each one having 3 weapons/gadgets and 3 abilities. So basicly you can make 9 combinations for every single one of them,  in total! They are all useful, my favore is by far the FTL jump and awareness, also the FTL phase shift.5.  ♥♥♥♥ those things dude. I don't like choosing carefully what to unlock, you just have them when you level up, that's it. Great. Neat. Awesome. Thank you.6.  They are not supply drop weapons, such as in BO3, you can get them for free if you have the season pass, if not, you will have to grind a little for them, not a lot, will take you about 5-6 days to get them, all three of them, so awesome, better then BO3, much better.Anyway, this is a really fun game by itself. I'm really enjoying it, and if you are  a classic boots on the ground harcore fan, you are gonna enjoy this, espacially if you are really agressive like me.Is it worth the 60$? I don't think so, but many games don't. Get it at a sale, deppending on where you live and how much money you make, 30$ is a pretty fair price for it.

Randomly disconnecting during games: EXTREMELY annoying.3. Balancing: 6v4, 1 team might have 6 sub level 20's, the other might have 4 level 50's and above first prestige.4. Tryhards: To many.5. There's obviously not going to be another CoD game until the end of this year, might as well make the most of what you have.I do have to admit though, when playing it, it didn't really feel like CoD, it didn't feel as smooth as say Black Ops III did, if anything it felt smoother, but not really in a good way. Honestly, all I'm saying here is to give Infinity Ward a chance, sure, maybe Infinite Warfare isn't what you thought it would be, but I know many people who like the game for a part of it (campaign, zombies, multiplayer), even its entirety. Infinity Ward worked for over a year to make this game, and everyone is flaming hate over it.I'm not a major CoD player, I play these games casually. This review may not apeal to the competitive players out there. All I'm saying is a CoD game is a CoD game, all are different but revolve around the same mechanic. If the annual Call of Duty game is bad, either don't play it or make the most out of it until the next one releases. All this hate won't even matter after the next one releases so what's the point?

I understand, because I once was angry when the Power Rangers & Pokemon left Earth and went intergalactic on us all when I was a child.The graphics are insanely awesome and I'm using a GTX 750 TI. The cinematic cut-scenes in solo mode look promising as I've only downloaded and played multiplayer mode. The online community isn't chalk-full of "professionals" who live and die by a simple FPS while living in their mother's basement. I'm new to this game and although I'm not the best, it's incredibly fun and great practice for online multiplayer. I recommend this game off multiplayer alone, and if you can, I'd snatch this game while it's only $29.99.
UPDATE:This game runs great, seems antivirus prgrams do not like cod. If you temp disable avg it runs no problems at all. I do enjoy this game, it is like a mix of black ops 3 and advanced warfare. In this cod the server is more in sync (ie opponents are not seconds ahead of you). I have yet to try the campaign, but zombies are very noob friendly. They made it a lot easier to sneak by zombiesa nd get to higher rounds. The multiplayer is improved from the previous cod. It is more in sync, less camping, less jumping around. Progress carries over from multiplayer to zombies and vice versa, which is awesome. I think one of the best cods in awhile. I changed my review from negative to positive, because I thought something was wrong with the game. There is not, it was anti-virus program preventing it from running properly.

Ok, early review.  After being dissapointed that the free weekend was just a multiplayer demo, I have to say that after actually buying this (from a reseller)  I am very impressed. I would NEVER buy this for the multiplayer, too many angry 13 yr  olds griefing everyone.  The single player, so far, is a decent experience. It's well optomized. The combat is intense, the visuals are exceptional.  Have not had a chance to try zombie mode yet.  Kit harrington is an easilly hateable villain.  8/10 would fly into space again.
Game's is really well optimized and runs perfectly even if my pc doesn't meet the miminum requirments in 1080p 60fps stable, same goes for MP.The story is big and there's a lot you can do. It's up to you, to chose what to do. Either play the story missions or jump onto the side missions. Stunning visuals suround the world around you. But however you are most of the time on different planets jumping with the speed of sound to travel around the universe. The game is definitly easy so do crank up the difficulty bar. P.S Finish on any difficulty and unlock much more different game changing gameplay.Sadly not all game modes are active most of them are very scarce to find players. TDM is the most popular gamemode you can enjoy atm otherwise the different classes really dont add much different into the MP game since they dont give you any benefits of using weapons for their classes. Instead they get a premade weapon.So is the game worth your money? It depends on the person but I would say wait and buy it on a sale.
Call of duty : Infinite warfare is most underrated game of all time. A lot of people hates this game because it's "not boots on ground" and that it takes places in space. However, how is the game beyond those points? Campaign: Campaign story manages to make you care and even some scenes give you those sad feels (i'm talking about ethan robot in space while our main charachter dying in space, saying to him that he's our friend etc.) , however, story is mostly pretty straight foward, there no huge twists and it's not entirely deep story either (not like black ops 2) however, the story , for what it is, is well written, the voice acting is amazing and over all, i was looking foward on what happens next. Charachters are not entirely memorable, but the game will make you care for them . To keep it short,  The story is a huge step up from other generic cod titles (like ghosts) so it is worth atleast a play trough.Multiplayer: i haven't played it on pc, simply cause community is dead, (more on that at end) but i played hefty ammount on xbox one, anyway it's Wayyy better than bo3. The guns, everything is more balanced. Also i very appreciate the mode called "tactical team deathmatch" in which jumping jetpacks are disabled. There are good viarety of modes available and it's really more balanced than previous cod game, however, the pc version seems to have a lack of modes available from console versions (for example, i couldn't find hardcore domination, when they do have hardcore moshpit) however, i feel like it was decision made by developer to keep other modes more alive (instead of people going purely to domination, they make you go to moshpit where there's various modes cycling every map) whatever this is bad or good decision is debatable. Another issue, community/ player count is pretty much dead on pc. You can barely find match of TDM where on console version, it's very alive and healthy. Zombies: best part about this game. WAYYY bettwr than bo3, the progression is wayyy more improved. The map is extremly fun to play, it's addictive, you can earn supply drops keys with it, it's mostly simple to play, it's just amazing. If you wondering to pick this game up, i say do it for zombies! It's really worth it and i'm excited about dlc maps that coming out.The port is great , the only issue with port i have is chache options is somewhat very demanding on CPU , even on high end ones, which means if you don't disable it, you will have stutters, other than that, the dosen't look that bad but does not look that great either, for 2016 , it's decent. The port is very well done. I can't also rate mp netcode, simply cause again, on pc . It's dead. Ghosts has very serious issue with mp code on pc which made mp of that game just unplayable. I dont know about pc.If you willing to look past "duhh hurrr cod sucks bf1 is better xDDD" people, YES the game isin't as bad as people say, actually, it's very good. The game is fun and on sale, it's well worth the money. I enjoyed all the modes, and i got pc version for zombies alone, which really is best part about the game. I also enjoy playing multiplayer (on console) which is something i did not enjoy doing after bo2. Solid 8/10 i highly recommend (unless player count increases) getting it on xbox though, unless you're purely interested in co-op zombies. While i do agree, that cod should go back to it's roots, i don't think this game deserved a hate that it got. IW did an amazing job and it sad that due the hate, some of the talented people behind this game got fired for it. If you look past the hate, there is a hidden gem there, while it's not a 10/10 daimond, it's still a gem that you should give it a try

I know by just looking at the reviews this game seems absolute garbage, and that is why I didn't buy it yet. But now that the free weekend came up I thought I'd give it a bash, and boy was I wrong. Of course i'm only talking about the multiplayer here as the campaign nor the zombies are available in the free weekend. So, why do i think it is good despite all the reviews that say that it is total garbage?Well first you should know that the last cod i played was black ops II, so this hover/wallrun mechanic is completly new for me and so far I quite like it for what it's worth.Secondly, I strongly disagree with everyone who says that the weapons are unbalanced. If you play 5 matches with any weapon you will get the grips with it and you'll get better with the minute.Of course this game is not perfect, it has it flaws, but i have not experienced any hackers or server crashes in the few hours that I have played and I'm still enjoying it quite alot.Just keep in mind that It is definetly not worth the full 60 or so bucks. But on sale (or♥♥♥♥♥ I would say pick it up if it's below 20 bucks.

I downloaded the trial they're (were if I forget to edit this) running and I really enjoy it. From the getgo I was surprised a game from 2016 ran at a playable framerate and looking generally good without completely dying on my computer. Each map had something that gave it flavor. The maps range from mediocre to garenteed fun. The latter really shine. On one map where dead bodies stand upright making it a hesitant decision to shoot, while another could just be both pleasant from both a gameplay and aesthetic perspective. Overall, it's singleplayer tier maps in multiplayer. As for the gameplay, the action is really fast paced and reminds me of when I'd play Modern Warfare 2. There have been changes since then, like a jet/booster pack that's fun to mess around with and doesn't distract from the core. Overall a nice adition. There is, however, aditions I don't like. I'm not too fond of some aditions though. I didn't like the new wall run mechanic because it doesn't have much reason to exist than to look cool. There's also an Overwatch ultimate esque system where your rig (class) has an abiltiy that charges over time. These abilities range from extremely powerful to extremely situational (if not completely useless).  I'd rather my character is dictated by his primary wepon rather than something that was rarely used in my time playing. As much as I just complained at this game, I still want to purchase either this or the next game in the series and I have a large feeling I'll do at least one of those.

I got this game because I liked the series and the Call of Duty franchise. This one is different from the others because of the fact its mostly in space hopping around the solar system fighting John Snow and the Olympus Mons. Game didnt get the high marks that soem of the others did but I really liked this one. Looks and runs great and have yet to notice any bugs. High res and 100+ fps is no problem. If your machine can handle it. I recommend this game and think you'll like it just as well.
I don't understand the hate on Infinite Warfare, yes it's based in the future, it's still an amazing game. Unlike every other sotry in COD this story is fully linear, it's a story which panned out well and played well. The fight for survival and not giving up when it looks like you should plays out very well. Zombies is like classic zombies but with challenges and played out like a movie which is completely different. The only thing I disliked about Infinite Warfare was the lack of leaderboards in Multiplayer, now that they are added it's not to what I hoped, being in the Top 10% of a gamemode is impossible as it isn't based off of your score totalled, it's your average score per minute which allows cheaters to get in the Top 1% easier that it already was before.
Game mechanics are good,Dedicated servers are needed,Better cheat prevention methods need to be in place,Several ingame issues that should be resolved before launch,Stop nerfing guns that don't need nerfs, and stop releasing overpowered guns.

Infinite Warfare's campaign is the second-best part of the package in my opinion, beat only by Zombies. The story, which deals with a massive civil war in the Solar System, is probably the most inventive narrative since Black Ops and is full of awesome set-peices, likeable characters (particularly Ethan, a robotic Petty Officer), and fairly original level design. There are, of course, the classic Call of Duty irritants that have plagued the series since its inception, most notably grenade spam and death corridors with respawning enemies, but the pros of the campaign far outweigh the cons.Don't buy IW for multiplayer. It's an inferior version of what was offered in Black Ops 3 and just feels like the same Call of Duty crap, except plagued with hackers and balance issues. I played about five or six matches and just stopped bothering; my time is better spent in the Campaign, Zombies, or MWR.Holy crap, Zombies is fun as hell this time around. All of the maps have a classic movie theme, with the first map being set in a 1980's theme park called Spaceland that is overrun with the undead. There are new team-based mechanics, a more forgiving death system, really cool easter eggs and minigames - it's just straight up fun. Zombies is the best part of this package by far IMO and is almost worth $60 alone.First up, the graphical improvements made in this remaster are nothing short of stunning. While it doesn't look quite as good as IW, it's still a really solid and refreshing way to make the game seem new; the lighting effects are particular standouts and had me pretty impressed all the way through the campaign, which is still as fun as it was when COD 4 came out. The multiplayer also has these improvements and is still as fun and addictive as I remember, making it vastly superior to IW's multiplayer both in design and enjoyment. There are (surprisingly) more people playing MWR anyway, so finding a match isn't difficult at all. If you're willing to shell out $80, MWR makes the entire package worth every penny in my opinion.
Game is alot better than i expected. Dont get me wrong though this is not really a COD roots game but it is still decent. probably shouldve waited for price drop though.
Campaign and zombies are great. Multiplayer is bad.
now im not one for general reviews or anything but i can honestly say that this game is actually fun, i have been a fan of call of duty since MW2 and i can honestly say im finding the new sci-fi settings more fun then before, now i know most people wont agree with this but this game provides a higher level of challenge then before it makes you think alot, for instance a place that used to only have 1 entry point could now have 4 entry points making players think on spot and react quicker and its also alot harder to hit someone that is flying through the air then it is on the ground, all round this game is a fun break from the boots on ground CoDs and for me its a highly recommended game

It is very strange, even for my self to admit, that I do enjoy this COD installment. I was not a fan of all latest installments and my big experience on this franchise ended with MW3 series. I did gave some shots on  futuristic CODs SP experiences prior to IW, but personally I do like this one the most. New outer space setting is really well made with good looking grafics and stable high fps! Reasonable story plot, zero-gravity and hazardous environments, robot hacking, open space with fancy grapling-hook, fighter dogfights, full Solar system theme and Kit "Jon Snow" Harington. Although it is not game changing or essential shooter, but definately well made one with really enjoyable campaign.I really do enjoy fast paced purified MP, which contains all previously gathered good experiences.Zombies co-op is addictive and fun as always! In my humble opinion best COD Zombies so far and I do like this funny retro horror movie theme! Well made big map (hope upcoming ones will be such as well) with so much easter eggs, z-traps and awesome mini carnival games. Just pack a punc and you are good to go for the highest scores!Also, Modern Warfare Remastered is a brilliant remake of the modern classics, which altered existing grounds and established new standards for whole FPS genre.Infinity Ward keep on doing great job!As for FPS I give 9/10, as for COD installment strong 8/10

good gamje, bt a bit of bs
Ok there will always be lovers and haters for the call of duty series,i fall somewhere between the two.Although i hate the fact that call of duty has gone all futuristic i don't hate it as much as some others out there.Once you adapt to the fact that just running and gunning is no longer an option you will be good to go.Jumping and wall running are absolutely critical to doing well in the multiplayer side of this game.Once you embrace that notion your scores and kill streaks will start to increase rapidly.There are some awesome weapons in this game and some not so awesome weapons,if you are new to it then i suggest the Nv4 assault rifle in any variant.Recoil is minimal to say the least and it's a great starting gun.If at 1st you are just being killed,respawning and being killed again,all i can say is stick with it.This happened majorly to me in the beginning but being the stubborn so and so that i am,i just persevered until i became reasonable at it.Many people are saying that this is the worst call of duty to date,i disagree with that (remember ghosts!).All in all i would say that if you are a die hard cod fan then you will not be disappointed in purchasing this game.
If you can play this game with an open mind and ignore all the hate to form  you may find yourself liking this game afterall. forewarning though: this is a different type of call of duty title, meaning it could be a shock to players used to the history based CoD games.Now that I have completed the campaign, pumped hours into multiplayer, and explored the zombies mode, I think I can say that I went into this game with an open mind and I was absolutely not dissapointed. This game definitely got a bad rap and got a lot of hate simply because people aren't willing to try new concepts with an open mind. I love the original call of duty games from world war II just like I love the call of duty games now with the futuristic side. I like them because with the futuristic setting a developer can play with different ideas and story elements that a dedicated time period such as world war II would hinder due to technological constraints. For instance, obviously we don't have "directed energy"  weapons, and I loved the creativity Infinity Ward put into their weapons simply because they weren't bound by the constraints of a particular time period. BTW I love the richocheting bullets . I'm not easily moved by campaigns but the end credit monologues had me in tears, sure perhaps I'm a sap simply because I can relate to them, but I loved the campaign and it puts a new spin on solar military combat.Multiplayer is sadly dead, it is fun if the only game mode you like is TDM or Domination but otherwise if you're getting the game just for multiplayer, then save your money. I love the scraps system where you can upgrade weapons to which they can have different abilities and scorestreak modifiers, I think that is a great concept. I'm not a fan of the microtransactions but businesses gonna biz. Zombies isn't really my forte, it does feel like Infinity Ward is trying to cash in on the popularity of Treyarch's take on Zombies and I think that they should leave the zombies to Treyarch and focus more on the survival game modes from previous IW titles, I personally thought they were developed better than their take on Zombies. Lastly, the price tag and the inclusion of MWR I think wasn't the smartest idea, they are now planning on letting  which is great for those who want the remastered experience of IW's greatest game. The price tag is purely to your own value. IW and many partners put thousands of hours into this project and if you feel this game is worth $60 than go for it and help the developers, if not, wait for a sale. I personally am not thrilled with the $60 price tag and I know many others aren't either. If you're hesitant about getting this game, wait for a sale, buy it and if you don't like it, return it so it doesn't put as big a dent in your wallet. I need water now because I verbally spoke this as I wrote it.

I think everyone judged the game and said it was terrible before it even came out, and then continued saying it was bad even if they never played it. Do I think it's the best COD game ever? No. Do I think it's bad? No. I thought the campaign was extremely good, one of the best campaigns I've played our of any game, easily could've been a super good Sci fi movie. Multiplayer is multiplayer to me, it's good and fun but nothing special. I got this game mostly for the zombies mode, which I think is extremely fun. It doesn't compare to Treyarch, but it's a different type of zombies than treyarch so you can't compare it. It's somehow felt like Battlefield 3: Horrible at launch, but after a while, after adding a DLC and patches, the game feels good. There are of course cons, which I don't understand why did Infinity Ward re-added some stuff to the game, like the Overpowered Akimbo, which was one of the most hated things in previous Call of Duty series. Treyarch did a great job with it, by nerfing them and it took a bit of skill in Black Ops 3, but if I had to choose between IW and BO3, I'd choose this one. People say that Infinity Ward don't make any good Call of Dutys anymore, but for me, every single time they released one, I was never disappointed.

No robots were harmed in the making of this game !!
I write about the Single Player game mode. I just finished it and saw the credits to the very end. There was a note of the developers who tried to make the best game they could. In my opinion, they succeeded. The story line, written by Brian Bloom, is deeper than the usual FPS story lines. It seems informed by a kind of melancholy quality that I recognize in those who have fought in wars and have lost much. There is also that balance to strike between humanity and ruthlessness that the characters wrestle with. The foe, the SDF, has a zealot quality whose animosity towards Earth is opaque. We never find out why Mars's Kotch chose the path he did, just that he chose war. Perhaps this mirrors the soldier's perspective, "It is not for us to reason why..." I do also like the character of E3N, the sentient android, "Ethan". He (it) does bring to mind the coming of the "singularity" where humans and AIs might not annihilate each other but fuse into something more than the sum of parts. So, a game that makes me think of what it means to be human in a world that always seems to be riven with conflict, is a great game. As for the mechanics, the COD line of games has honed the game play (I used the PC) to the point where realism is immersive. A surprising feature is the, well, feature capture of the actors. They play themselves. Their real-world likenesses appear in the game. They have managed to jump clear of the "creepy valley" effect that plagued Tom Hank's likeness in Polar Express. Well done! It was good to see Farscape's Claudia Black, by the way. In conclusion, an excellent game and story line. Well done!
a very fun game you should really buy it

As many of you know, mmost of the Call of Duty players is tired of the futuristic Call of Duty games. And I am one of them.But! I have to say that, this game is hands down the best of the futuristics versions of COD. It just kind of feels like, this is what they intended to do in Advanced Warfare and Black Ops 3, but didn't really suceed. The Campaign on this game I give a solid 8/10, great casting and interesting storyline.The multiplayer, can at some points feel a little funky, but that's okay, you get used to it after playing it a while :)Zombies in spaceland is a great concept, though it takes some time learning the easter eggs. And I think that they could have put in at least one or two more zombies maps, without having to pay a bunch for season pass. I think they should have that in mind next time they make a Call of Duty with zombies in it. PS: I've played ever Call of Duty in the franchise since COD 4 Modern Warfare (Which I also got from buying the Legacy Edition) Even though it's not the best Call of Duty ever, I would say that it's pretty good :)I play this game on a Strix GTX 960 4gb card, and it plays very well on high, with a few setting turned down a little.
The first COD I played was COD 2 way back in the foggy mists of time. I've never been a hardcore follower of the series in recent years however, with a lot of the titles being pretty drab and tiresome for a single player campaign lover like myself. With that said, I did give BLOP3 a shot and it bored me to tears. However, on a whim (and because it was cheap), I thought I'd give this a whirl. I'm glad I did. This is the best COD campaign I've played in a long time. Don't get me wrong, it's still pretty hammy in places as far as the story goes, but I found myself engaged with the believable characters and storyline which allowed me a good 8 hours plus of gameplay (including side missions). I feel that the addition of space battles and occasional zero gravity combat alongside the meat and potatoes 'boots on the ground' action added some variety and freshness to the series. Also, having had a crack at the zombie multiplayer campaign, that too is also bags of fun as a side from all the futuristic robot bashing. All in all, a hopeful resurgence in quality for the single player portion of the series.

Read why I recommended this game:I got the Legcay Edition of the game on sale from Humble Bundle for 59.99. The only reason I wanted the game was to play Modern Warfare Remastered. There are some slight frame/refresh rate bugs when you tab out and stuff, but they're apparenty making an update soon to fix it, but I'd still recommend getting the legacy edition for MWR if you played cod back in it's prime.

So I got this game for the single player campaign, and... I loved it.The story is by-the-numbers but has enough twists and trope revisions to keep things fresh. The missions are split between pilot and cover-based shooting, the former being a little repetitive and under-developed, but all in all a good game to get on sale.Multiplayer Zombies is brilliant co-op fun, and have no interest in PVP, which is what this game is so heavily panned for...Highly Reccomended on sale, if only for the SPC and Co-Op modes.
Unable to connec online online worst COD of the year!
This review is based on campaign only, as I wasn't able to get on the multiplayer due to lack of players & matches available on Steam.This campaign was very unique and felt way more different than any other COD game I have played. Now to me this is a great thing. I enjoyed every mission in the game, and the graphics were amazing. I really enjoyed the fast paced space battles in the Jackals more than anything else. I feel like this could be a seperate game of its own using this engine. It was really cool idea of the reloading drones. Plus I liked the simplicity of the weapons for this type of warfare. It made it feel more like an arcade feel though then a space/flight simulator like Elite Dangerous for example.  I never really could stay interested in the campaigns before, but this one kept me entertained. I will say there was a few glitches as I bought it as soon as it was released. After the first big patch it really optimized the game. It looks pretty awesome at 5760x1080 and runs really good on my Nvidia 870M 3GB  in my MSI laptop. Now there is a sound issue, seems to be software only. I have Windows 10, but it effects all as far as i know. I learned some people who were saying this may fix your issue, if you get this game and have any issues. Go to your sound manager in control panel and change your sound to Stereo. Its the only one that works for some reason. I found out this helps with most my games, even with 5.1 speakers attached. If you are still unable to fix the issue, I also heard steam will give you a full refund as long as you haven't played to far into the game. So I conclude with this a great game, especially for COD series. Its unique and I really enjoyed the feel of the game, the cinematics and the campaign isn't super short. You even can pick your missions and unlock some upgrades to help you out. My favorite parts of the game are the jackal strikes and I really wish there was more of them honestly. I have seen this game get a bad rap because the sound issue. If your into the multiplayer only though, I recommend xbox one for that as there is a sad lack of PC gamers on the multiplayer.
best game eva
Call of duty Inifinite Warfare was an attempt at making something the community hated something they could like, with the far future enhanced movement and such. This game attempted to combine aspects of many call of duties before it, with the Specialists of BO3, the time to kill of MW2, The Map design of Ghosts/MW3 and the far future setting of Advanced Warfare. It turned out to be the worst selling COD of all time. But, in my opinion, it is not a bad game. The campaign is one of the best the series has to offer, and the multiplayer has modes that completely remove the enhanced movement. Many people would find this game fun if they just gave it a try, and didn't let some big youtube content creators tell them its a garbage game. Half the reason this was the worst selling game is because thousands of impressionable people did not even glance at it because their favourite youtuber said
This game is far better than some idiot on the internet will say it is. If you like Call of Duty Black ops 3, you will probably like this one. campaign is fun and refreshing with cool space battles both in ships and on enemy ships where you can use a cool grappling hook to attatch to pretty much anything. The story and characters are kinda generic (except 4 Ethan, he's cool) but pretty good anyway and far better than BO3's campaign (plus in this one you fight Jon Snow).Multiplayer isn't very good in this game however as its pretty much a carbon coppy of BO3's mp but  bad with a clunky thruster pack, overpowered weapons avalable in the supply drops (pay 2 win), tiny maps, extremly quick time to kill, some cool weapons (for example a sniper that becomes an assult rifle with a button press) but the rest are kinda boring and forgetable. The specialists from BO3 are back yet pretty sh*tty this time as the claw is ovrpowered and all the others are kinda meh. Also back from BO3 is the extensive weapon customization, which is always a good thing, and this is in both MP and zombies.zombies is probably the best part of the game with the new map, Spaceland, being really fun. its quite an easy map compaired to previous BO3 maps and its not as good as treyarch maps but its still really good for Infinity Wards first go. The Pack a punch is easy and simple to get to as it opens up as you make your way around the map, clown rounds are fun yet tense in higher rounds when you have low ammo, the map flows well as portals here and there to get you to safety.  I also really like the whole generic 1980s theme of the map as well as the characters. There are a few things about this map that can be very frustrating: the brute boss zombie is very hard to kill and can completely screw up the game, some of the lanes are very narrow making it hard to get around sometimes. As a whole its a pretty good game, not the best Cod at all yet definatly not the worst, yeah the multiplayer isn't great but if your a zombies fan like me then you will probably like this. MP fans may wanna look somewhere else for a good MP experiance. if your into futuristic warfare then try Titanfall 2 (GOTY in my opinion), for competative MP fans who like objective game play i would reccomend Overwatch (or titanfall 2), or if your looking for a good campaign then try Battlefield 1 (or, once again, titanfall 2). In terms of call of duty however, I would reccomend Black ops 3 over this one any day. 6.5/10

Rule one: ignore all the fkn haters, judge for yourselves.In my humble opinion this game worth it for the campaign alone. The best campaign since modern warfare 1+2 and black ops . The futuristic setting doesnt harm it but gives the game variety with technology and weapons. Realistic military story with  strong characters that make you care and mourn their loss. The story also talks about how  being a man and a leader involves making hard decisions and it is a great aspect of the story. Gameplay: The weapons sound and react  great, each one is unique and doesnt feel like watergun. After you finish the campaign you unlock specialist difficulty that makes it feel like another game with different gear you must use to survive and your limbs gettin shot. I wish they used the wallrunning and jumpkit better.And on top of that you get multi and zombies which are good. Overall the team showed great talent in gamedesign, and this game deffenetly deserves better than the reviews it received.

I think this is a fun game.The campaign in Infinite Warfare is very immersive.  I love the plot of the story.  The characters don't seem as memorable as other campaigns, but I like them, nonetheless.Multiplayer is very fun, to say the least.  I know the supply drops are a bit of a let down, but other than that, the multiplayer itself is nice.  The gameplay is very smooth, and so far, I've never encountered any glitches.  It really did bring back the old "Call of Duty" Feel, as I've come to describe it.The zombies mode itself is incredible.  The style of the game is very original, which is something I like.  I like how they had David Hasselhoff in Zombies in Spaceland; that's one of my favorite parts.  Killing zombies also made the experience fun.  Plus, the zombie clowns startle me, especially the first time I played zombies mode.All-in-all, this is a good game that simply needs the attention it deserves.

Second review. After so many patch updates, i can say the game is now very fun. The main complain people are making is about hackers. I would say that i usually have a good overall game play even if i notice some cheaters and feel good when i beat them even when they're cheating. I mean, name me a single game that doesn't have hackers as todays date? None even if VAC is enable. By the way they just enabled VAC yesterday with the new patch which means way less cheaters from now on. To be sincere, i never played COD so much since the first modern warfare. For some reason this COD is very addictive. Don't pay attention to the complains and give it a try. I think this is the best MP and zombies game play ever.

Multiplayer awesome like alwayscampaign is blow your mind great graphics/spaceships/weaponszombie mode it's too cool
A lot of people might say this about Infinite Warfare: It's trash, garbage, waste of time. But if you actually gave it a shot, then you might change your mind about it. My cousin(and friend on steam)gave me the Digital Deluxe Edition that includes DLC and MWR, I honestly found myself more excited for IW than for MWR(since I've already played the original MW). Probably because I like futuristic games, but try it at least.
Now, Let's have an honest look at this game.The game runs amazingly well for me. I haven't had a single stutter in the game in my 26 hours of playing this game.I had a look at all of the currently available modes:CampaignZombiesMultiplayer (PvP)So let's analyse each of them in their own section shall we?So the Campaign has a great immersive story with a decent amount of content. It took me about 10 hours of playtime.What do you do in these 10 hours?Well, that's not that easy to describe due to the large variety this game offers.The basic part is obviously the whole shooting on foot. The weapons feel well balanced and enemies react well to beeing shot. They don't just run to their position sit there, shoot every now and then and stab you when you are to close.Well they still stab you if you get to close.But, i remember a situation where I had to defend some sort of chamber and it was the most fun I had in shooters in a long time.It was a huge chamber with 2 floors and several TYPES of enemies. They offered me a lot of stuff that goes boom and said HAVE FUN KILLING!Enemies flanked me and made it hard for me to just stick in a position. So my solution? Fight through one side and force my enemy to reposition them which gave me some easy kills. Get some explosives to deal with the big guys and so on.It's a situation that shows how much fun a modern military shooter can be as it mixes some classical shooter elements with new shooter elements.Sadly Health still is on regeneration and not on pickups/Medpacks of any kind. But well it's CoD that's to be expected.Enemies have improved a lot. And i don't mean "oh they kill me faster" way. I mean, they ACTIVELY try to flank you and surprise you. They have a better Ai than some games that are purely PvE like Payday 2. The Ai is horrible in that one.So the ground part offers a lot of open spaces, with space combat and much more. It's great and one of the best I have seen in a MMS.Now the second big part of the campaign is flying a freaking Space Ship. It does feel great flying through space shooting other pilots in their fighters, while sieging carriers. The game keeps momentum in Space (as the rules of 0 Gravity dictate)It doesn't always feel completly fleshed out and it can be sometimes a bit hard to actually understand where everything is.There is a whole lot of things to explore and the campaing convinces with a solid gameplay and amazing Space sceneries. Beeing able to blow up windows in a space station to let enemies get sucked out into Space just feels great.Zombies:This one felt a bit out of place for me. It takes place in a movie. 4 Players fight against oncoming hordes of zombies that will get stronger over time. Players get money for fighting off Zombies and can buy more parts of the Space Park where they can find better weapons to buy or better positions to defend.I haven't beaten it and doubt it can be beaten as I had a Zombies session going for 40 minutes.Lots of upgrades and abilities dropped by zombies as pick ups keep the mode fresh.It's fun getting the unlimited grenade upgrade and blowing up zombies with grenades for a few seconds.Definetly worth trying out if you like Zombie game modes. It's well made and has it's own kind of humour.I have personally never been a fan of these modes but I can see player putting in 20+ hours in this mode easily.Multiplayer: Oh boy, it's a fast paced PvP shooter. People die fast but a slow paced approach can often help aswell.Sieging positions. Tactical grenades and so on.It's a normal Multiplayer with a lot of unlockables ( if you are in that kind of stuff...) which bothers me personally.I haven't felt like I have no chance due to not having everything though.It feels amazing to kill a few people by flanking them and giving them a few quick head shots.The community is surprisingly nice.If you aren't into the fast paced shooter though this could be frustrating.Technical stuffs for PC Gamers:FoV goes up to 120.You can render up to a 200% render resolution to increase fidelity of the game.Colourblind mode: AvailableFPS: Solid Stable 60 FPS (I wish for 144 but well it's good enough)AA: SMAA T2X and FXAABorderless window mode available.The basic settings you'd expect are all here.Nothing is missing.It really is a solid game and can offer a lot of fun to players who are open minded to the whole sci fi setting.The Campaign alone is worth the price tag.DO NOT BUY THE SEASON PASS UNLESS YOU LOVE THE GAME! AND I MEAN REALLY LOVE!Don't let random hate comments overshadow the game. Look at honest reviews.It's currently a "cool thing" to hate on Call of Duty. The game doesn't matter for these people. Random hate is more important.People don't point out why the Infinite warfare is "the worst cod ever"I don't want to invalid those peoples feelings. But you have to keep in mind: "Are these people actually informed about what they are talking about"I don't mind having hate on this positive Review. But as someone who hasn't played much CoD before I was surprised how much fun I had/have.Be a smart and informed Gamer instead of a sheep in the herd.Have fun gaming!~ChickenDash
single player is good, maybe a little bit short but it's interesting and its got Jon Snow in it.multiplayer is actually quite fun, the movement is interesting and keeps things fresh.Would probably get it when it's on sale but it's good
Honestly i really like it;Great campain (amazing story and variety with  the upagrades and jackal fights/upgrades)Great zombies (basically activison zombies (which is amazing))The multiplayer is pretty good just the servers are not that full but the rest is goodI think that this game would have done well sue to all of the above but it was just released at the wrong time when the community wanted somthing else.

Campaign: AlrightZombies: GoodMultiplayer:â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥
First impressions: no zombies played. First of all the campaign start is gorgeous. You are taken into the future, new world, new conflicts. There are some issues with the cinematics having a bit of stuttering but that doesn't ruin the gameplay. When you take control, the game runs smooth, fluid and has awesome graphics. The multiplayer feels a lot like Black Ops 3 and even with starting gear it feels good. You have a ton of specialists and things to experiment. About the hatred this game received: First of all, COD MW1 was missing from my collection and it felt a bit annoying to be forced into buying COD IW in order to access COD MW1 Remastered. From all CODs i have played, i enjoyed the most MW2 and MW3 so it felt like i should have MW1 also. Then i realised i actualy wanted both games. Yeah, i do want to experience Feet on Ground from MW1 and i also wanted to see the new game. I thought about it, and i did pay for COD MW3 100 euro to get the game and the DLCs. Now for 100 euro i got IW + DLCs and MW1, so in financial terms i did get more for 100 euro than before. It is a lot compared to other quality games like CSGO that cost little and offer so many hours of gameplay, but there is also a lot more content to explore in CODs. Compared to CSGO, you get single player campaign, quality cooperative maps and bigger multiplayer content. You cannot compare the competitive parts because in COD games you have to play to unlock things while in CSGO you get everything from start and all you need to develop is the skills to become better. What i dislike the most about COD games is that when new game appears, the previous games become deserted. They should sell old versions that lack people for a lot less money. You do not have 50.000 players online so why ask for a full price when you should ask for 10-15% of that price? You already made the sale when that game was released, give people old games for cheap and they will make efforts to buy your new releases. Why settle with 100.000 premium buyers when you can have 10 million happy customers? Lower prices = good business. Think about it!Back to IW, if you can afford it, it is worth buying it, otherwise you can just watch the walkthroughs and gameplay on youtube and still experience the game that way. Enjoy it!!
Love the game! - It is perfect if you like to enjoy an actionloaded popcorn movie story to play through combined with good shooter gameplay.-Graphics and i encountered no big bugs at all.-Story is not long but it was entertaining the entire gametime.-Multiplayer i have to admit I haven't tried.- It's not why i bought the game.
it a ok game but unfortunantly not much people are online :-( so its hard to find a match. but do give this game a chance its decent. i only paid Â£15 for this just keep that in mind.
lol bought this just for the zombies i have always like their zombies they need to just stop all of it and only make zombie games i know they would be better at it :D
Being playing through single player so far it is quite a good game.Not yet played Multiplayer so cant comment on that yet.
This game isn't actually as bad as i thought it would be.

Trying to do the easter eg is very challenging-Multiplayer is work in progress-Modern Warfare Remastered is exceptionally better and there is more people on it My CONSNot really worth the price. -No leaderboards-No rank/competitive base gamemode-No proper stat placement-No medals/badges to show any of your accomplishments just -"coming soon" on some of the tabs, which imply the game not fully finish -"Bad port for PC" is false. So port means from  console to pc so yah my bad-Random crashes-Multiplayer progression is way too slow-A limited amount of players which makes games harder to find (everyone plays TDM)-weird 91fps cap. Everyone was saying that this game is really, REALLY bad. So I gave it a try. Its actually pretty fun. If you are good at fps type games then you're good to go. Multiplayer is fun and lobbies only take long to find if you are playing past 1 am. Campaign was interesting being able to fly in a jackal and zombies is great as always. I give this game an 8/10
I held off on buying this game because of the negative reviews so I waited until it was on sale and picked up the digital remaster edition off of Humble Bundle. The content of the single player campaign on Infinite Warfare is pretty awesome. It doesn't really feel like a COD game. The weapons feel pretty great and the small extras such as the seeker grenades are an awesome addition to the game. The only con that I have noticed is the horrible frame drops during some cutscenes. I have a GTX 1080 and I will get drops down to 14 FPS on 4K resolution. The gameplay rarely droips that bad so I'm not to concerned about the optimization of the game. Overall I would recommend the game for single player as I haven't tried the multiplayer.
Well after reading a bunch of reviews I held off purchasing this game for quite a while. But I really wanted a new cod so I took a chance. This review purtains to multiplayer only:I'd like to start off by saying that there arew few to no hackers in this game,  people just constantly accuse good players of hacking. It happens to me plenty and I just take it as a compliment. This annoys me because so many reviews talk about the hacking problem which I dont see happening.I mainly stick to team deathmatch so I dont usually have trouble getting into games as the majority of the player base is here.The guns have a large variety and many can transform into different types of guns, perks are pretty standard, and scorestreaks are not too different from past cods. The rigs are similar to operators from black ops 3 but have more customization options and abilities, I really like them in this game.I'd like to finish by saying I'm really loving the multiplayer in this game and have already put in 60 hours with more on the way. There are not really any bad maps and the game is fun and addictive as ♥♥♥♥.
Well after reading a bunch of reviews I held off purchasing this game for quite a while. But I really wanted a new cod so I took a chance. This review purtains to multiplayer only:I'd like to start off by saying that there arew few to no hackers in this game,  people just constantly accuse good players of hacking. It happens to me plenty and I just take it as a compliment. This annoys me because so many reviews talk about the hacking problem which I dont see happening.I mainly stick to team deathmatch so I dont usually have trouble getting into games as the majority of the player base is here.The guns have a large variety and many can transform into different types of guns, perks are pretty standard, and scorestreaks are not too different from past cods. The rigs are similar to operators from black ops 3 but have more customization options and abilities, I really like them in this game.I'd like to finish by saying I'm really loving the multiplayer in this game and have already put in 60 hours with more on the way. The content in the game is honestly pretty good. The biggest issue is the lack of a suitable system for connections. The amount of times bullets are clearly hitting the person but not registering is very annoying, especially without aim assist. I am seriously on the edge here, because I don't want to give this a positive review to make the publisher feel like what they are doing is right, however, I can't give it a negative purely because the campaign and the zombies are pretty solid. It is hard to judge the right price to buy the game at, since I would mainly buy it for zombies, but without the season pass zombies is only one map. However, the season pass is priced insanely high AND it is supposed to be for multiplayer content, too, which is irrelevant at the state COD is at right now. Therefore, I can only recommend if the digital deluxe edition is on sale for a reasonable price. People who truly love COD multiplayer may still like it. I just feel really sad as of now because the "future" setting is already hated on for no reason and now it is being tainted the wrong way, whereas I could see people realizing that it really is fun without the poor technology implemented for modern use in terms of internet-related content.
very good game, it has come a long way. bo3 was good but AW was disgusting.
This...this is a good game, yes it might follow a lot of the unifortunate cookie cutter tropes of the franchise, but haven't played a CoD since MW1...and being a huge fan of sci-fi...and a lot of the amazing minds they brought into make this a reality...Infinite Warfare is easily one of my top sci-fi games. It feels good, it's short...but it's packed full of *stolen* or creatively borrowed mechanical motiffs for gameplay, but what can really be done at certain points. It's not like we can just not use concepts that are legitimate for the settings, or cast aside the standards of what's conventional, etc. That said, most of my joy from this came from the clearly divergent aspects of what makes CoD "CoD" or whatever you want to call it. The space, the slow moments, the almost Mass Effect style RPG elements, it was amazing! I'm not going to lie to join the hate wagon, I still don't like a lot of aspects of this, the focus on MP, the studios...iffy background...etc. But being able to enjoy the Retribution and the srrounding game...Infinite Warfare is actually a good game to me. I want the era of the Retribution to be real, I want humanity to realize it's potential. And that means taking our collective baggage and pushing it to the limits, with time, we will change, and for a time, it will be good. Just like this...
It saddens me to see so many mindless idiots bashing the game without even experiencing the SP campaign to its fullest. First of all, the SP campaign had difficulties higher than veteran which is challenging and fun. The story is a little bit cliche but fantastic and they added side missions into the campaign where you do have some degree of decision making(basically go loud or stealth). Yes there is imperfections to the game (stealth is too easy) but this game is bringing back the excitement CoD had brought to players years ago.On the other hand, unfortunately, the MP is extremely similar to BO3 and AW, there are limitations to MP for devs to tweak them so I am not judging this game bad just because of that. You can encounter hackers in almost all online MP games and they do released patches to fix that. Another downside to this game is that the MP player base is heavily on console side and PC MP player base is kinda thin. In conclusion, please ignore all those mindless bashing and gice this game a try, if you are not a CoD veteran and haven't played MW before, it is also a phenomenal game so get the remastered too. If you are hesitant about this and because I mentioned few players on MP, wait for a sale. I am confident that this game is definitely worth its price.

For a start, I got this game on sale.Okay, so I honestly enjoy this game but that's not me saying that all the negative things aren't true, low playerbase, hackers, all that is true, but blown out of proportion. I never struggle to find a game (TDM and DOM), I don't play other game modes so cannot say for them. I also have never had lag issues (disregarding the time my router went down and caused lag until it completely shut off my wifi)So the biggest negativity is hackers, it's not as if every game is entirely full of hackers, in my experience theres only 1 hacker in a game, every 3 or 4 games or so. But the biggest problem is, even if they're reported nothing is done about it, I've seen hackers in games a week later, after multiple people reported them, TF is up with that?Now for my main pros:-Really enjoy the graphics + Plus they don't need amazing specs to run ultra (AMD fx6100, 8gb 2133mhz vengeance ram and an overclocked R9 280x will run max settings at 60+fps bar 1 map, that I cannot remember the name of)-I like the weapons, especially the different rarity weapons you can obtain, adds diversity to the weapons (I haven't played a cod game since BO3 so excuse me if this is in games between, I'm not sure)-The maps are very good, with alot of diversity of long|medium|short ranged maps, but all still fast paced.Overall I'd say 8/10, Definitely recommend to get at a sale price, would say don't bother at full price.♥♥♥♥♥amp;steam sales are your friend:)
I am comming from Black Op2 and Ghosts so I have no opinions on wall walking or jump boosting.Once I bought the game I jumped strait into campain and loved it immediately. The graphics were awesome the space setting was great and the fact that you start near Jupiter was marvelous. The campain's story was pretty good along with some twists from the missions that came unexpected. I havn't tried all but it's nice that there are side missions going to different planets or moons to fight more bad guys. The robot named Etham, one of the main characters, was one of the best parts of the compain. He made little jokes here and there and just made this story quite interesting. I don't know if I accidentally found an easter egg but half way through the credits you can hold right mouse and you see Ethan's head flying above mars lol.So next; the multiplayer. I think the mechanics were nicely designed, the quartermaster/supply drop system makes me rage a bit but that just casual. Most maps are very wall interactive and make you move alot in close and long range quarters. The reviews say theres lots of hackers, I've only encountered like 2-3? Most of the players are actually really good and provide a touch challenge sometimes.Let's move to zombies. This zombies is like no other before, if you don't know how Spaceland works before playing, you are strait up dead. There are many mechanics to learn and lots of traps and parts to collect that take you on a long journey. There is even an "easter egg" that I havn't tried myself but looks to be a great challenge. It is definately something to love about the new COD. Also the DLC for zombies "Rave in the Redwoods" I think it was called, looks intense with lighting and that "party feeling."I want to say something about most of the negative reviews. I see that most people don't care for futuristic games as much as they used to and many are moving to Battle Field 1 (of course if a few do it, everyone is gonna hop on the band wagon) but thats natural. But some of these review ares just really bad and don't have a purpose or thought in them. One more thing is that people only care about multiplayer (I guess?) and only write their reviews 5min into a "bad" multiplayer game. I just wish people made more clean reviews.Summary: I think COD Infinite Warefare is a great game overall and theres no need to put "hate" everywhere.Thanks for reading.

I can honestly say that the game is not all that bad. The campaign was fun, a bit confusing (but simple), and interesting. I feel like the characters were developed by a sufficient amount as I felt attached to them during the ending scene. Graphics are beautiful. Gave my mediocre build quite a workout.Here are the things I did not like:The weapon choices were not very well thought through. There is zero diversity. I feel like the developers made the first gun in each class, copied and pasted that gun like 4 times, and then made minor changes to the model so that we would subconsciously think each gun is substantially different one from another... yeah no.The only other major thing that I didn't like was how simple the campaign was. The MW series kept things original with ongoing plot introductions and changes. This game was way too dry. Also, if you are going to have the game be space themed, you cannot have humans be the sole race involved in the action. Adding aliens adds weapon and vehicle diversity. At least in previous COD releases (that were earth based), the weapons and vehicles were at least a little bit familiar. Throwing all of these new weapon names at us without a sufficient amount of personality with said weapons results in bleh. To give you an example, the Needler from Halo. It is alien but is different in its own way. Another example is the MSR from MW3. That gun was my best friend for many many months because it had the kind of personality that allowed you to open up to it and unlock its full potential.To sum it up, IW was a copy-paste of BO3 with more middle finger. 6/10GG
I have to say that this is one of my favorite Call Of Duty games. I realize opinions are pretty polar on this game, but I find it to be a fun, fast paced shooter. I really enjoy the maps and the design of the weapons and armor. After having propulsion packs and being able to run on walls I almost feel like it would be hard going back to a game that was "boots on the ground". Maybe even boring. Only cons I'd give the game is the same I have for all the Call Of Duty games I've played (and I've been playing since Modern Warfare 1) - the cheaters. I don't understand why people feel the need to cheat. Part of why I love these games is to overcome how much I always suck initially and to actually become good at the game. There's no real sense of accomplishment with cheating. I don't get it. But I digress. The cheaters suck. I don't see the company doing much about it honestly. But, it's still a fun game and you can always get a new lobby after a match if you don't want to play with someone who is cheating. But I really really do wish the company would put a huge smackdown on these guys. They could use an engine update as well. It's not a game breaker for me, and don't get me wrong, the graphics are good, they could just be better. I hope that whatever their follow up to this (though this may not be the popular opinion) they will keep with the futurist theme. Or at the very least they stay with a Modern or Advanced warfare setting. I'm really just not interested in shooting people with guns from the 50s. Sorry BF1.

I LOVE THIS GAMENow to start off, I just want to say that the money I paid for this game was totally worth it!I have been wanting the game since it came out on my birthday (Das right bois, my birthday every years COD release date)and I have enjoyed every minute of my playtime. CAMPAIGN - I love ETH3N, (but in all seriousness) I love where this story is going (as I have just started it) and I died so many times trying to crash myself into the SDF ships XD. MULTIPLAYER - Now even though PC cod players only play TDM, with the mission team objectives I feel like I am actually trying to get something or somewhere objectivly in any gamemode I get to play. Even though BO3 did do this through the black market contracts, I feel like it didn't do it as well as IW has done it with them changing literally everytime you complete one.ZOMBIES - This is a...... different take of zombje story that Infinity Ward has taken. I am going to be honest here, I was a bit stingy at the idea of Zombies in a amusement park in space near the 1980's at first, but know that I understand how to story is progressing, it is something I could get behind. Of course, its story will never match what BO3 had and I will like bo3's alot more than this, but I will enjoy playing it and its story.Now people are going to hate me on this, but I am starting to prefer this over BO3. Now don't get me wrong, I will always go to bo3 for some good zombies, but this game (in my perspective) has a better multiplier experiende and an amazing campaign story (besides, you can't honestly say that bo3's campaign wasn't at all anti-climatic) Now, I can't say this is a perfect COD title, I mean almost three months into its life and there are no leardboards, custom emblems, only ever TDM is really played (which is just how PC players are) it still gives me an amazing experiende with all the different features and modes (Campaign-Multiplayer-Zombies) and I would gladly stay with this game for a couple years and buy its season pass if I had the money.

no one ever online zombies
I enjoyed this game personally so much that I felt I'd like to write a review for it, so that other people looking for the same things I look for in video games might give it due consideration...Overall : this is the most satisfying COD single player campaign I've ever played. Make no mistake, it does not, overall, veer far from the standard COD formula, and suffers from many of the same basic problems that all COD games suffer from i.e atrocious ally AI, uncommonly accurate enemy shooting, and obnoxious difficulty differentiating enemies from the surrounding environment. Nevertheless, I have enjoyed this COD game single player campaign vastly over all other COD games...The multi-player aspect of the game is an entirely different story...but I'll get to that later1 - fair warning - I vastly prefer modern, ultra-modern, and sci-fi era shooting games, and as such, Inifinite Warfare falls exactly where I want it to as far as the setting goes. For people who dislike sci-fi-esque era games, be warned. But as an example of a good solid sci-fi era ultra-modern-tech kind of environment, IW nails it. actions all over the solar system, in space and on the ground, offer a fantastic variety of different looking and different acting environments that I found very satisfying 2 - this COD game carries a considerable amount of reasonably varied single player content - I've got nearly 12 hours of single player campaign time in, and I'm only now reaching the end.3 - The game offers a fairly wide variety of engagement types - reasonably fun, fast, and simple space/aerial battle zones, ground stealth combat, a single ground infiltration mission, a reasonable variety of regular ground combat zones in a variety of interesting locales, and some zero-g combat. All of which follow *mostly* the same basic mechanics, but the mechanics work pretty well, and the slight mix-ups on objectives and styles of approach makes for a satisfyingly varied gameply4 - the story is...reasonably...fun. The main enemy is routinely one-dimensional, which is a tad disappointing, but nearly all the rest of the cast are reasonably memorable, interesting, and fun to watch as the game plays it's story out.5 - while I find most of the gun visual design to be bafflingly ugly, the mechanics for how the guns work are excellent - all the standard variations are here...smg's for rapid fire, AR's for mid-range rapid fire and accuracy, shotguns, sniper rifles, etc...they all sound pretty good IMO and they operate differently enough that it's relatively easy to find a few that work with whatever shooting style you might prefer6 - the secondary devices (grenades and special equipment) are, I feel,  a highlight of the game. Offering a suprisingly effective variety of very different effects, it's easy to find something that changes up the game while also being fun to useOverall, between the choice of era, the relatively large amount of content, the solid gameplay mechanics, and the wide variety of visuals and game-play types, I've found this particular COD single player campaign to be one of the most satisfying in years.My multi-player experience has been far less satisfying, for numerous reasons, however, my MP experience has also been far less numerous, due to the many unsatisfying reasons...so take that for what you will.MP is just about everything COD is known for, love it or hate it. It's fast and it's twitchy and it has at least it's fair share of hackers, if not more.  Worse, however, is that this is the first COD that I've had innumerable connection issues with - usually COD is a relatively fun if somewhat unfulfilling mp shooter for me, but at least it's usually stable and I can count on it - so far, I've been dumped by at least close to 9/10 of my matches due to being "unable to establish secure connection with host" - there are numerous threads online bringing the problem up, however, solutions seem to be...inconsistent at best. For my own part, after managing some rather detailed port forwarding, I've had exactly 2 games out of nearly 20 attempts that I've been able to play all the way through - and they weren't that much fun...at least not for me.still, if you can find it on sale and enjoy an active shooter single player campaign in a sci-fi era environment, I highly recommend Infinite Warfare. I'm a less valuable advisor on whether you should buy this for the MP component - if you do, I strongly suggest that you find out first how to reach your router menu, call up the guidelines on steam and activision for port forwarding, and then flip a coin...
After finishing up the 20 hours campaign, I must say I am happily surprise by the production value and enjoyable experience I had playing through it.After Black Ops 3 and Ghost, my expectations were dim and my faith in Call of Duty campaign died out. Personally, this is a really good Call Of Duty despite what people are thinking. It is fast-paced, and not pay to win unlike BO3 and AW. I recommend this game, however when searching for a match it can take a while to matchmake, so be wary of that. Overall I'd give it an 8/10.

A great game that got hate because it isn't the same as the first CoD games.rip
Surprisingly good single player campaign… Despite a weak first act and poorly written antagonist (not helped by Kit Harington’s phoned in performance) the second half of the single player campaign was a thrilling experience played out by characters and stakes I genuinely cared about.  Infinite Warfare works at its best as a pastiche of other sci-fi and war films (notably Star Wars and Aliens) and at its worst when it attempts to replicate earlier COD level design and cheesy military dialogue.  Given timing of its release; comparisons to Titanfall 2 are fair and Infinite Warfare admittedly struggles to offer the same level of satisfying gameplay.  However, IW’s world building is miles better and its story delivers a far more touching emotional relationship between humans and artificial intelligence (Jeffrey Nording’s performance of the robot solider Ethan is brilliant).  The rest of the diverse cast are also genuinely excellent (unlike Titanfall 2’s dull mercenaries) and this further heightens the cinematic feel of the single player campaign.Game ran well on max settings at 1080p60 using 6 GB GTX 1060 with some great sound and visuals (including solid mocap) for most of the game.   Overall highly recommended.

Infinite Warfare is a good game, I'm not going to compare it to battlefield becuase they aren't even close to the same game. The multiplayer is fast-paced with all the wall running action from Black Ops 3.Zombies is twice as fun and has a few cool new features such as mid-game spawning and the ATM system from Buried and point-sharing for expensive doors. Spaceland also has an awesome soundtrack including songs from bands like Twisted Sister and Europe.The Campaign is surprisingly open and has multiple missions to select from at your will, I havn't played enough of it to give it a true rating but the missions I have played have been quite fun including a stealth mission that gave you full control and never took the reins (Rare in a CoD game).Modern Warfare RemakeCampaign is amazing, look good and plays just like the original, sadly no new features were added, a bit unoptimised at times but overall fun.Multiplayer is still multiplayer, no anticheat and the same generic gameplay, I had more fun checking out Infinite Warfare than I did the remake, it was good to see this game with such awesome textures but thats all it is

Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare is another great mindless shooter from the franchise. There are some aspects of this game that I liked and some that I didnt like about the game.I'll start off listing the positives: + Multiplayer is fun, balanced and well ported.+ The story mode is better than the past few COD campaigns, actually had a engaging story and character development. + Zombies is a blast. But I prefer the older COD zombies maps.+ Customization is great, weapons dont all feel the same.+ Replayability is very high, due to COD being a mindless fun shooter.Here are some negatives that come to mind:- IW is placed in the future, I was really hoping for a WW1/2 setting.- FPS Capped at 90 fps..like cmon.- Community is small and makes it hard to find games in multiplayer.- I have ran into cheaters on multiple occasions. (Aimbot/Wall hacks)Overall this is a solid game and I do recommend it to pretty much anyone. For real tho...its a Call of duty game, why such high expectations?My Rating: ★★★☆☆
