Ever since the final mission in 007: Nightfire, I've had an insatiable desire to enjoy first person combat with cool laser weapons in space. This game scratches that itch brilliantly. I've never been a huge fan of CoD, nor a serious CoD player by any metric. I've always loved zombies but never really touched multiplayer - and I hadn't played a campaign through since Big Red One.With this game, that has all changed for me. Despite the game's poor reputation (in my opinion, an underserved one), the game is quite strong. Whereas BO2-3 and AW sort of stumbled in a weird middle ground of sci-fi, cyberpunk, and alternate reality future-tech warfare, IW finds itself quite comfortably in raw sci-fi.The CoD formula works very well in the context of galactic warfare, and although you'll seldom find yourself forgetting that you're playing a videogame, nothing is too absurd or too unbelievable to palate. The campaign is really quite excellent, and although fairly linear, you do make some small decisions and have optional missions that you can undertake. There's a refreshing, albeit minor, sense of freedom here. Zombies in Spaceland is pretty cool, although it gets old somewhat quicky and doesn't really stand up to extensive play. (But that could just be me.)The multiplayer is actually a lot of fun. It can be extremely frustrating, sure, and it's quite chaotic, but it's an enjoyable way to spend an hour or two of freetime during the weekend or on a weeknight. There's loads to do, lots of small goals to accomplish and plenty of weapons, attachments, camo, features, and so on to unlock. It's entirely possible to earn all of the above without making use of the game's microtransaction system. If you're a seasoned CoD fan, this one might not be for you. If you're someone who enjoys shooters and has can't get enough of FPS games in space, you should definitely consider it. The price point might be a little high, but it's worth getting on sale.I don't reret buying this in the least. In fact, I'm really glad I did. It looks utterly fantastic, it plays well, and, above all else,  it's fun. After all, isn't that the point?

Well what can you say.  It is another game in the forever series that is Call of Duty.  I have always liked COD as it is more of an arcade style game that I don’t have to commit much time to.  Multiplayer is good when you can find a lobby.  The player base is so low its almost laughable.  If they banned for hacking that would be great.  There are days I can't find a lobby without a hacker in it.  When you find a decent lobby, it is an enjoyable game, even if I am getting Rekt.  The spawns are terrible at times but that is the case in most COD games.  The maps are fast paced with lanes of travel in every direction.  Snipers don't own, run and gunners get shot in the back and knifers have a harder time owning on every map.  To me it seems balanced.  Not talking about netcode, just maps and player styles.  Speaking of netcode, its terrible.  With all the advancements in our world, I am amazed they are still using a modifed engine.  Time to wake up and write some solid stuff to improve latency and of course prevent hacking even before a new series is released.  The weapons are good.  I like the addition of classic weapons.  Some weapons are OP as usual but for the most part I don't see one weapon as the favorite.  Well the Type 2 is the weapon of choice but akimbo mode has  limited in range. Snipers have to actually be good at it, and shotguns have to be close.  Are they perfect? No, but not too bad in my opinion. What is hilarious are the taunts and actions of the players.  They are horrible.  3Arc nailed theirs in BLOPS 3.  They were so stupid it was funny to have them.  In this game, they are just ridiculous.  Players  taunts try to look cool but oh my gosh they are terrible, absolutely terrible.  Single player is great.  No complaints there at all.  Great story, logical flow and challenging missions.  Can’t say anything negative about single at all.  Not a zombie player so I can't comment on that.  All in all, this isn’t a positive nor negative review.  If you have played any of the last 5 COD games, then you have played IW.  I will forever enjoy the series as I started with COD2, I just hope they return to normal COD with intelligent map layouts, solid weapon balance and a solid (although not perfect) anti-cheat system.  If you like COD at all, you will like this game.  If you are a COD hater you will hate this game!  Frag hard, game on.

Pretty fun game, certainly the first Call of Duty I've looked at in a while and actually bought soon after release instead of waiting for it to come down to about Â£5. The gameplay is a lot more fast-paced, quit reminiscent of the soldier movement in Titanfall, and takes parts of Vanquish and Blacklight Retribution to make a fun futuristic shooter.The campaign is ok, from what I've played, but as with most CoD players, I'm mostly on the multiplayer. Unfortunately, the multiplayer is awfully unbalanced, with spray and hope shotgun players being more effective than any other style. SMGs and Shotguns are heavily forced upon you, with SMGs acting more like over-powered assault rifles. If there's a map where taking in a sniper isn't suicide, I haven't played it yet.So, if you want some fast-paced futuristic action, this is a great game. If you're more slow-paced, or, god-forbid, a quick-scoper, you might want to give this one a miss, because they did a great job ensuring snipers cannot be used like shotguns.
you need 8 ram
Just a heads-up, this review is only for Zombies. In short MP is fun but pretty unbalanced and campaign is better than BO3 cause it is actually playable with casual play and isn't trying to be a mindboggling mess. If I write something very weird then it's probably me not knowing the word as I am not a native speaker. With that out of the way let's dive into the first sceneZombies in SpacelandNow since I haven't played this game from launch, I have no idea at how atrocious and unbalanced it was. But I atleast know the easter egg was extremely hard to almost unbeatable. But before that let's start with the basics of theGameplayThis map and IW Zombies in general feel like they let you get away with alot of stuff that Black Ops III would not allow. Like sliding into a horde of zombies and getting away with it. This map is honestly a blast for even a starter as it's really simple unlike the newer maps that aren't as BO III intense but still aren't easy before you learn it. The starting room shows you all the basics of the map, the perk design, how the zombies get in the map and most importantly how to turn on power (and if you still don't know what you're doing there's a tour guide in the starting room). After you open the door, you find the main area that'll lead you into the 3 sub-areas, from left to right - Journey Into Space, Polar Peak, Kepler System all with their own distinct features and mascots. I kind of admire this level of detail the other maps lack. This map is a real good fun learn and'll prepare you for the new maps. The guns are all good until the late 25s to 30s when they just become crawler-makers. For example the Mauler is really good in terms of holding ammo but makes too much crawlers. I'll be honest the best weapons are the traps and if you want an actual gun then it's the Pack-A-Punched M1 as it has a really cool reticle (the DMR-1 is good too, it's just a modernized M1 so it has the same effect but isn't a wall-buy) that hits any zombies as long as they are in the reticle, add it's great damage and ammo capacity + easy to reach wall-buy and you have a gun that'll get you into the 40s atleast. Oh yea and all the DLC weapons except the meeles are in the box and after being obtained/having the SP you can customize them with laser sights etc. and level them up.MusicWhat I love about this map is the soundtrack, while I now listen to my own, it's still really great 80's music. The others sadly don't have as much, for example Rave has about 30 mins of music and the music only plays in one area, but we'll get to that in Rave. But even better are the perk jingles. Actual musical perfection, seriously these are better than Black Ops' jingles. Same goes for the character intros, sadly combined they are about only 44 seconds long so there's not too much to listen to.StorylineOur 4 actors are very distinct but still pretty much stereotypes, Pondexter Zitterman - Your average nerdy type in real life and even a bigger nerd in Spaceland, Aaron "A.J." Jordaniels - A strong guy that's a jock in Spaceland, Andre Wright - Instead of choosing to be some street thug, Andre chose to pursue films, in Spaceland he's the rapper, Sally Simpson - An actor that was overshadowed by her much more famous parents, she plays the Valley Girl. After all arrive through a limousine they enter the theater and Willard Wyler welcomes them, they enter the theater screening and Wyler pretty much sells their soul as they get teleported to Zombies in Spaceland. In Spaceland the 4 actors Defeat Zombies and co-operate with David Hasselfhoff, the park's DJ and make a Seti-com that attracts the alien UFO that crashed in Polar Peak. Once they do all the steps the alien(s) (Depending on if there 1/2/3/4 players) step out and try to kill the 4 actors. After the actors defeat the alien(s) they destroy the UFO and acquire the Soul key aswell as the Alien Fuzes which let them Double Pack-A-Punch.Overall ratingThis map really got me into IW. After the EE boss fight was patched it was still hard but it was fun. If i'm honest gameplay-wise this map is what I got out the most. I'm not gonna give a rating but here's to you, if you wanna buy this game just because of this map, don't. It's not worth it. Getting the Deluxe edition or just the Season Pass is what I recommend as Activision as the idiots they are sealed it to either have Season Pass and all DLC or no DLC. This isn't as quality as Black Ops III is but I still enjoy this probably even more than Black Ops 3's Shadows of Evil by alot. Overall I really like this but it will definetely not be for everyone.Since this review is way before being finished, and the fact that I still need to finish Shaolin Shuffle's, Attack of The Radioactive thing's and The Beast From Beyond's Easter eggs, after I do Rave in the Redwoods I will not update this review for a week or 2 depending on my completion.

My review is for the singleplayer game only.Review summary:Pros: Decent campaign, non-linear compared to prior COD titles.  Cons: Has technical issues on graphical setup, and the prior COD title did not have these issues (Black Ops 3).I think the graphical setup issues will frustrate many customers.  The game also has issues with multi-monitor setups (like mine).Overall: On the PC I recommend this game _only_ if you have a very high-end system and you can be patient with adjusting graphical settings.  Once you get the game configured to work properly it plays well.  If you don't have a high-end PC then perhaps try on a console instead.I'll start with the Technical issues since people will have problems here.  If you have performance issues do the following:Technical Issue with Graphical Settings and Work-arounds:* Texture settings: Set these to Normal from High.   On High the game was a slide-show in many combat scenes.  Setting Textures to Normal completely eliminated the problem.* Caching of sunlight and shadows:  Disable these two features.* Run the game in Windows-borderless mode - this works fine for me and is practically the same as full-screen.Also on the Steam forums there are some graphical optimization guides posted. I would refer to those if you have any problems.Also, if you play on a projector, you will need to set your "cloned" monitor to the desired resolution you want in-game, and then start up your projector, and then run the game.  For whatever reason the game tries to lock in the resolution to your Windows desktop resolution.  It's a puzzling technical design choice, as you cannot try to adjust different resolutions on the fly, such as switching 1920*1200 to 1080p (1920 * 1080).   This is the first COD game played that I had this issue.The game does have a graphical setting to pick which monitor to play on, but it doesn't seem to remember the setting.  Also the game kept wanting to run on my smaller secondary monitor, instead of my larger primary monitor I clone my projector from.  So to get around that issue, I had to unplug the secondary monitor before running the game.Overall I'm glad I have the game running, but disappointed I cannot run with high-end textures.Campaign Gameplay:Once you get the game working, the campaign is pretty enjoyable.  You have a non-linear campaign and can pick from missions that offer different rewards to aid your character's skill progression and fighter ship abilities.  You can also fail a mission (I guess) but even so the campaign still continues.  The strategy title Battlefleet Gothic:Armada had a similar campaign mechanic.Anyhow, giving a thumbs-up, but it's conditional on if you can get around the technical issues.

I don't understand the hate for this game. In fact, I'm really enjoying it, especially the campaign.Campaign:There is no actual way for me to really describe it. I'll just say it's really great. Combat, especially the space sections, are very well executed, contrary to popular belief. You just know the writers behind the original Modern Warfare were behind this. It was just very well put together.Multiplayer:It's really kind of a mix between MW2 and Black Ops 3. I honestly hated it at first, but that was just five minutes into the multiplayer. I didn't give myself enough time to really sink my teeth into it. Sure enough, after a while, I'm starting to enjoy it more and more. It's a little more than decent, but be sure to give yourself enough time to really get into it.Zombies:It's a little less fun than Treyarch's zombies, but it's still enjoyable. It just feels kind of dumb, that's all.Optimization:Contrary to some idiots who think their potato is good enough, IW actually runs quite well on the machine I'm playing it on, about 90-100 FPS on my EVGA Classifed SuperClocked GTX 770. The people who say this port is very buggy probably have something on their machine that's causing the problem, or maybe they don't have the proper hardware.Comparison to Battlefield 1:I know I'm going to♥♥♥♥♥♥a lot of people off with this statement; BF1, aside from it's graphics and World War 1 setting (big whoop) , has a sub-par story that and a multiplayer that's fun, but ultimately shallow in comparison to IW. I don't care how much EA is paying AngryJoe or IGN to sell out, BF1 is ultimately a shell of a game, at least from my critical standpoint.All in all, Infinite Warfare is a great CoD. Not as good as Modern Warfare, though. There are a couple things I would change about IW, but that's pretty much any game these days.

EDIT: seems that the lip sync and stutter issues are limited to the first Geneva mission's cutscenes and/or have been patched since. Now the game performs great and looks amazing in 2160p with everything on ultra except AA. I also never understood the hate for this one, sure the traversal was played and not as good as Titanfall 2, but the sci-fi plot was a reasonable move for COD considering by MW3 people were literally asking for a COD in space. This is COD in space, and it has excellent visuals, superb acting, plus an open ended mission design. For my money this is an excellent COD campaign, even if the science side of science fiction here is VERY dubious. Highly recommended if you enjoy solid COD action and science fiction. Just played 30 minutes and wanted to share. Loved this COD on Xbox, I don't share the opinion that COD is bad or that this specific COD is particularly bad. COD in space is something many of us asked for back in 2011 or so when the Modern Warfare phase was beginning to feel stale, and IW is that wish come true. On Xbox S it looks great and runs without a hitch, smooth, stable. Of course on PC in 2160p and everything set to highest it looks "better", but it's a bad port so I'd suggest staying away. If you have an Xbox or PS4 you can enjoy the company of lovely Jamie "Salter" Gray Hyder on those, it's 90% the same experience. As a PC game, this COD fails. No settings until you start a mode (on PC settings should be available right after hitting start), terrible lip sync issues in cinematics, game crashes/freezes when changing video settings....that's in 30 minutes. I won't ask for a refund cause still, 4K Jamie, but if you're not insane like me save your money.

This is the first Call of Duty game I have ever played and i really enjoyed it.  I don't perfer shooters like this but I had to try it because I love sci-fi/space.  My biggest problem with this game is that the campaign was too short, there were only like four main missions.  They were really long though, especially the last one.  The whole campaing took about 16 hours to complete.  Another issue is that you are the captian of this massive star ship but there are like only four rooms you can freely go to.  You can go to a few others but only at the start of a mission.  The developers nailed the Sci-fi/space theme in this game.  Each planet and moon that you visited was unique and awesome to look at.  The controls for the Jackals were perfect, you never feel disorientated while flying around, there were two buttons that I wanted to rebind though, but I didn't know what they were called so I couldn't, they werent essential though (3 and 4 for rolling).  A few of the human controls were awkward, but just a few keybind changes and it was fine.  Pros:Amazing sci-fi/space themeGreat Jackal controlsAmazing sci-fi/space themeGreat graphicsCool charactersOh, did I mention amazing sci-fi/space theme?Cons:Short campaignSlightly awkward keybinds

After seeing all the bad reviews I waited for the holiday sale to dive right in.Only played campaign, Normal Difficulty, took 8 hours completing all side missions and main lineOverall, solid 8/10Runs brilliantly, they did an amazing job here and is very well optimised.Awesome for any scifi fans.Shooting mechanics were similar to other CoD's + some interesting gun and equipment mechanics for the futuristic setting.Story was fine, nothing that will change you for life but you'll get the motivation of the characters.Space combat was fun, felt a little guided but made for a nice change of pace.If you're looking for a fun, scifi themed, single player shooter campaign made by those withon years of experience in the genre buy and enjoy your 8-10 hours!No comments on multiplayer as haven't played.
A nice warmup to the next Mass Effect.CoD has flirted with space with several memorable scenes in previous games, and I remember thinking "I wish they would make a space game, it would be so pretty and awesome". They've only bloody gone and done it!Clearly a lot of inspiration has been taken from Mass Effect, including wandering the small interior of your ship, looking at that familiar map screen with useless but interesting nerdy info about planets to pick your next mission from, and a robot buddy.I think the game manages to balance between the two audiences it aims to appeal to. There are the regular Call of Duty fans who just want shoot foreigners, but this game will of course appeal to space fans, who will be hoping for incredible vistas and floating around in space. From the start it provides all of this, with the opening taking place on the frozen plains of a moon of Jupiter, and an incredible vista of Jupiter, complete with swirling winds, in the background while a storm rumbles in the distance, all reflected off the infinite stretches of ice beneath your feet.Infinite Warfare not only emulates Mass Effect, but raises the standard. Remember the Mass Effect level with the giant sun that burns through your armour if you stay out of the shade too long? The same gimmick is here, but now you're on an asteroid spinning chaotically toward the sun, meaning the sun is rising and setting or just spinning around every few seconds, and the sun itself is awe-inspiring to look at alone. This is something only before seen in young amateur astronomers' nightmares after too much cheese.Shooty gameplay is nothing new for Call of Duty, but now you will have some dogfighting missions in space or on planets, as well as zero-g combat and space walks, all as fun as to be expected. Multiplayer is multiplayer, zombies is zombies. Even I'm getting a 0.50 kill:death ratio so this might be a more enjoyable multiplayer for the less 'leet' players.And yes, Claudia Black is in this.
Wow, what a game. Seriously impressed. I'm not big into the online multiplayer aspects (although I can usually be tempted by Zombies), I like a strong campaign with a decent story. I know some people get CoD and other FPS games purely for the multiplayer aspect without ever touching the campaign, if that's you then I'd honestly recommend giving the campaign a shot this time around. Oddly enough, most of the negative reviews seem to regarding poor online experiences, so I'd play the campaign for that reason alone; Infinite Warfare is possibly the best story since the Modern Warfare series. IW is still not without flaws however, some of them forming a disappointingly common thread throughout the CoD franchise, but they don't impact game play too much.Intel i5 650064GB DDR4 RAMNVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080 FEDirectX 12SSD StorageI know the processor needs upgrading; it's on my to-do list. ;-)I think if Mass Effect were released tomorrow it might actually look quite a lot like IW. This is the first CoD game to introduce side missions and give you command over which, if any, you do. Completing the side missions gives you various perks and upgrades, plus some unlockables. Each side mission is also pretty unique; on one you sneak aboard an enemy vessel in disguise, in another you have to survive being ambushed and one has you gunning down high ranking pilots within a time limit. While the side missions aren't essential, the campaign is probably about 4 hours long without them, so I wouldn't recommend skipping a single one.This is also one of the only CoD games where I noticed genuine character growth. The player character, Nick Reyes, is an elite SCAR warrior-pilot who starts the game with the attitude that a commander's only obligation is to get his crew home safely. After taking command of the battleship  and having to make some tough decisions, he gradually comes to realise that there's a bigger picture to war and sacrifices must be made. Not everyone gets to come home: the soldier's mission is to win the war, not live through it.Okay, so the story and characters are solid, what about gameplay? It's CoD. If you've played any CoD game ever made you won't find anything unfamiliar in IW. The tactical overlay from BO3 is gone, but wall running and boosting is still in there. Shooting mechanics are solid, cover actually works, hit boxes are accurate... It's CoD. If you enjoyed how previous games handled, you'll enjoy this one as well. The only big difference is that there are some space fighter missions now. Yeah, you heard right. Remember that really boring part of BO3 where you were flying a VTOL around? It's a whole mission of that, except they've made it not boring, not railroaded and more like an actual dog fight. I enjoyed them, but then I quite like flight sim games. If you want to focus on gun play then you can skip them with no detriment to your playthrough; the unlockables you get from the space fighter missions only relate to space fighters and despite being a fairly new addition to CoD, the flight aspects are well done with the same solid controls and accurate hit boxes as everywhere else.Infinity Ward and Treyarch have had many years to polish and practice making CoD, so good gameplay in all aspects is to be expected. Where this game falls down is that it's sometimes unnecessarily intensive. Cut scenes stutter a lot, even short, slow ones. These scenes cross the uncanny valley and produce something that looks fantastically real, but they simply don't need to be that good. I'd rather not be able to see tiny blemishes on people's skin and reflections in their eyes if it means the scene plays smoothly. This was especially annoying in some of the more emotional scenes where the immersion was broken by juttering audio and poor lip synch. Cranking the graphics down didn't help much and given that everything was flawlessly smooth and fast loading during actual play with everything turned up to max, I was loath to turn anything down for the sake of the odd cut scene. This was my main irritant in BO3 as well. You also still get the occasional mission where there's so much stuff flying around and blowing that you lose track of what's going on or die and aren't sure why or what happened. In a way, I enjoy the frantic nature of these segements and imagine that actual warfare can be like that sometimes. But from a gaming perspective, it can get frustrating if it's not clear what you're doing wrong.Also disappointing was the lack of a co-op campaign. 'But wait, I though you didn't do multiplayer?' I hear you cry. I don't do online multiplayer, but I'm always on the look out for good co-op games. Y'see, I have a little brother and he doesn't get out much or have many friends, but he loves his PC and PC gaming. So going on co-op LAN adventures is one of the ways we spend time together. We had a lot of fun with BO3 and it would've been nice to be able to have another adventure with IW.Still, the occasional jarring cut scene and loss of co-op is a small price to pay for an otherwise excellent game. Overall, IW is probably my FPS of the year.

I can see how some people may not enjoy this game. However, I am a huge fan. I was previously a huge advocate of Black Ops III and Infinite Warfare greatly reminds me of that game. The campaign is very intriguing and exciting. Multiplayer would be fun if more people were on it, but there aren't any huge problems with it. It consists of more obvious challenges to complete and leaves you with something to play constantly. Zombies is wonderful. For infinity ward's first attempt at a zombies mode I personally believe they nailed it. Very reminisant of BO3 zombies, but still very fun. Overall I believe this game is well worth it. There aren't many, if any, problems with it. Love the game!

I stick to Zombies, I absolutely love Zombies in Spaceland - there is so much to do, making the wonde weapons is fun, fighting the brutes is fun and doing the easteregg as a whole is fun.I'd 100% recommend this game if you're still in CoD for Zombies, a lot of people dislike Zombies in Spaceland, but personally I think its great.
Full disclaimer:  I'm not a Call of Duty fan and I never have been, but this game is in a Sci-Fi setting with transitions from ground based FPS combat to Space Flight combat, which is what caught my attention.  I'm not interested in multiplayer and I am not concerned with pvp or zombies.  So, I don't really have an opinion about those aspects of the game.  I picked this up on sale.I'm loving it.  I'm only playing through the campaign, though.  It's like Michael Bay Explosion Porn with robots, spaceships, and guns.  It looks good and it's just fun.  I definitely think it's worth the $40 I spent on it.  I'm not under any illusion that it will be something I'm still playing a month from now, but it's good for what it is.The voice acting is good.  The graphics are nice, a little resource intensive though for my aging system, but nothing to keep me from enjoying it.  The space combat is a bit arcade-y, but the controls are intuitive and easy to use.  Not quite as involved as Elite: Dangerous, but it's still fun.  It still runs pretty well almost on max-settings.  My computer is about 2 years old this year, so take that for what you will.It will be a nice filler of a Pop-corn Flick type of game while we wait for the release of Star Citizen.

Frankly I don't understand where all the negativity towards this game comes from. Wild guess would fall on how Activision handled Modern Warfare Remastered. But if you look at Infinite Warfare alone it certainly deserved a warmer welcome then it got.Campaign is very solid: the story is engaging, it has a fairly resonable foundation, level design and gameplay were well made and overall I've got a lot of pleasure going thought single player campaign. Sadly it has little to no replayability to it, but still it felt far from what other COD games have to offer in terms of single player experience.As for multiplayer the only complaint I have is the poor selection of mp maps, and well, playerbase is far from huge. Yes, why not? Haters gonna hate no matter what. I'm not a Call of Duty fan, but this one is great, nobody can deny it. Its campaign has a great levels design, its characters has personality, the history is not bad, not fresh but it's well "narrated", the gameplay is fast and smooth. The campaign mode is dinamic, with main missions and side quests. Infiltrate in the enemy command ship using their uniforms, running through the shadows in the surface of a planet because if the light of the sun touch you it burn you, even a mission with some "terror" like in Alien...You has missions where you can use stealth, you shoot to everybody, there's many "film moments", you can pilot spaceships, there's space battles, you can infiltrate in enemy spaceships... You can choose when to do a mission, you can upgrade your gear, modify your weapons... The atmosphere, environments (planets, the interior of the spaceships, cities, stations...) looks so awesome. The soundtrack is great too.The game runs fine, I haven't experienced any problem, has a lot of graphical options to modify if you need to increese your performance. Graphically looks very well (people just complain in every game about its graphics, no matter whats, without sense). If Mass Effect 2 would turned into a FPS you would have this. The campaign is so damn good.About the multiplayer, I just played a few matches and it's fun, similar to Black Ops III, the other CoD that I played, maybe in a way less inspired, but still fun. Since I play to Titanfall 2 any online mode is boring for me, so I'm not interested in this game mode, but like I said, it's not horrible like people are saying.So, I recommend it if you like this kind of games, and well, I don't like this kind of games... but this one do, so maybe I can recommend it to a more differentiated public.
Don't care what the naysayers believe, this was a very well executed and thoroughly enjoyable game.

I'll sum up the negative reviews for you so you don't have to traul throught them:"I've played 3 hours of multiplayer and I think it's reasonable to get on here and tell you about how I'm an old cod player that is sick of jetpacks. No I haven't played the single player and when I went into multiplayer I assumed dying over and over was due to a hacker or something that everyone else says"Now here's my review, and I think it's fair to mention I am also an old cod player (And I too was skeptical about jetpacks)This game is very well done.The graphics are incredible (far better than Battlefield 1), I can tell they put a lot of effort into making the game look amazing. As well as the post-processing and effects it come in as one of the prettiest games out there. All the guns are unlockable, there is no pay to win because guns are in crates that can be opened with keys that are earnt pretty quickly. Sure you can pay for them too but the chances of getting a gun wiht anything good is too low to sit there spending $2 a crate. To be fair the multiplayer has the occasional hacker but ban waves are frequent enough. Multiplayer is fun, though not many maps but the maps they have are nice.The single player, although follows a pretty worn out plot (Group wants to destroy Earth for no elaborated reason, Hero and underdog allies foil the plan and save the day) the story makes up for it in length and depth of characters as well as some excellent voice acting, beautiful cutscenes and a fantastic soundtrack. One of the best Call of Duty single player experiences on par with Modern Warfare. If you are American you shouldnt have much trouble finding a match but anywhere else (particularly pacific) will have to wait a bit. It has its flaws, but I find it seriously sad that people judge a book by its cover. They did a good job on this one, it's an incredible single player experience with enough in multiplayer to make it worth your time and money. I can't say the same about MWR because its multiplayer is dead (at least until it gets released individually).

Where to begin..Well, I will structure this review into three segments and I will talk about each with my own & community perspectives. This will also Include a Review for Call of Duty: Modern Warfare Remastered. So; We have the Campaign. Now, I for one haven't even gotten past the first mission as I couldn't bring myself to play more of the game.But what I will say, is the game definitly entices me. It is quite interesting and overall done very well. Infinity Ward did a good job so far and the voice actors and model voice actors are good. Connor McGregor is in it!And from what I can gather; The Community has enjoyed the campaign as well. But with the campaign, I can't really say too much.And now for the one thing everyone buys Call of Duty for. The Multiplayer. And oh this one is quite the doozy, considering a HUGE amount of the Call of Duty Fan Base has wanted either a Modern Millitary Warfare type of game, or a World War centered game that is gritty and gory like the glory days of Call of Duty: World at War. Anyhow, this Multiplayer -- Well, it is hard to get my head around this. So I will review this as a PC player, and not like a reviewer. This game is a mess for the PC. Much like CoD MWR (More on that after).From a gameplay standpoint, this is essntially Call of Duty: Ghosts with a side of Advanced Warfare and Black Ops 3. The Aim Down Sights feel very stiff and hard to control. As if the sensitivity changes once I've aimed down the sight. Alongside that, the FOV View Model is horrible for PC. Especially on Snipers, for example the guns scope is virtually hitting your shoulder. Now this could be a bit nit-picky but honestly, most people have not enjoyed this game. So if you want to get this game for the Multiplayer, I suggest you try it out. And if you don't like it, get rid of it. This game is virtually dead on PC, and getting into games is a pure stuggle with the amount of disconnection bugs this game has.And now, for a mode that swept the nation. The Zombies Mode. Now this is not the first Zombies mode we have seen in Call of Duty. And infinty ward has done a damn well job of implementing a Zombies mode into this game. Giving us an eperience that is fammiliar whilst adding and feeling fresh all together. It works on the same basis as Treyarchs Zombies mode and adds to it with some unique features. Is this better than Treyarchs Zombies? Thats all up to someones personal opinion. I believe Treyarchs Zombies is better, but hell we've only got one map of off Infinity Wards explosion known as Zombies. This is definitly a mode you should experience with friends.The Call of Duty: Modern Warfare Remastered Review -This will be two segments, as it really only has two modes as a whole.The Campaign; And honestly. This remaster. IS PERFECT! They have completely rebuilt the original Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare game whilst adding some new but noticeable features and aspects that cause the game to pop out at players. The campaign felt, and played like the original Call of Duty 4. And I have to give props to Raven Software, they have done a good job on this game. Thats all I have to say; If you want to experience the Real CALL OF DUTY. Then get this.The Multiplayer, well. From a game aspect, it was perfect but Activision - Yes, Not Raven Software.. Screwed up this game. As for example this game was amazing at the start. Having a solid basis to build upon which included new features and new modes for people to enjoy the classic.. Repackaged. And thats when Activsion got us. They ruined the "Classic" feel of this game by adding Supply Drops. Though this won't be a rant on it, so just go online and search something up about it. Everyone hates it, and it is absolute cancer.Is MWR a good game? Yes. Is it a good game on PC? So-So.This game was a huge mess at first, on PC. Poor optimisation, no Cheat Detection and crappy peer-to-peer connection. But most of these issues have been fixed. There is now anti-cheat in this game, The game is getting more optimised than before and honestly it's an amazing game from a technical standpoint.
Needs an anti-cheat BADLY. Otheriwise it's a great game.
I love the game, if you a new player, it's not that hard to start know something about the game.If you ask me, I say buy it..
GOY? Nope, but this game doesn't deserve all the hate it gets, seriously. Hackers... yes I have ran across some but its not polluted like some of the online community seems to think. I think most of the "hackers" are actually controller users in my opinion because there is aim assist... Which makes this game really no different than any other COD, the big difference I believe is the TTK, which is ridiculously fast and makes that COD rage come out in full force for some people. The biggest knock on this game is the community which is none existant, and makes for a challenge to find online MP games at certain times but in no way makes this game unplayable. This game needs more players and for people to stop hating because its trendy to throw stones.

I like the multiplayer too, I don't know what people are on about. I even dare to say this game FEELS like the old school CoD at times (I guess it's thanks to Inifnity Ward). Call of Duty has always been my favorite FPS title. The polished nature of the games make the experience enjoyable. However, this installment has been a little frustrating. I purchased the $99 package that comes with C.O.D. Modern Warfare Remastered, bonus map, etc. The download was over 127GB (no that's not a typeo')! For that size I expected a lot. While the graphics are beautiful, a bug has already left me stranded in limbo during one mission. I ultimately had to redo the mission and it went through correctly the second time. The ship you're on does not have many features. Basically you can watch videos and take missions. They really could have done so much more with it, like allowing you to upgrade and customize armor and let you modify weapons and loadout outside of missions. Really it all seems like a basic FPS, not what I've come to expect from the C.O.D. franchise. I hope they enhance the game. With some relatively minor enhancements it could become one of my favorites!
I don't know why this game got so many bad reviews! It's a really good, solid single player game. I don't every play any multiplayer game so can't comment on that experience. This has as many twists and turns & a very good storyline as is the case with most COD games. I thought the dogfights in space were a welcome addition to this series, although the priming and launch animations became repetitive as the game progressed. The game is a tad shorter that I would have liked though. The only thing that I would like to have improved in this game is the number of weapons available. I felt it was a much smaller arsenal than those with other  COD games. I would recommend it to people who play only the campaign.
Subtitles how to change Chinese??
Campaign is really fun.Zombies is really fun.Multiplayer is trash.Buy this game on sale
If you're like me and don't care about the multiplayer then get the game on a sale. It's definitely not worth paying 49.99 or 59.99 for a 9h long singleplayer campaign.You play as Nick Reyes, a Special Operations pilot. Earth relies on colonies established elsewhere in the Solar System in order to mine planets and asteroids for resources. Mars forces, known as Settlement Defense Front (SDF) attacks Earth with only one goal in mind: Genocide.The SDF's flagship, the Olympus Mons, destroys almost the entire Earths fleet before it is forced to retreat, leaving only two operational UNSA ships: Retribution and Tigris.Captain of Retribution is found KIA after the attack and so you get promoted as the new captain of the ship. It is now your duty to lead the UNSA forces into what seems a suicide mission to save Earth.Infinite Warfare is more boots on the ground than the last two titles. You can still wallrun and double jump. However there's only a few instances where you really need to use those skills. As the captain of Retribution you have access to the "star map". I don't remember what the actual name of the table was. It's similar to what we had in Mass Effect 2. You walk up to this huge table, the entire Solar System opens up and you choose your mission. Yes, there are side quests in this game. Granted there's not many but they're all pretty unique and cool. You can dogfight through asteroid fields, go on stealth missions and just run 'n' gun.You can also choose your loadout before each mission. You are free to choose from many primary and secondary weapons. Choose their attachments. Choose your space fighters upgrades and stickers for a nicer visual effect. Why not, right?Other than that it's you classic CoD gameplay. Run, take cover, shoot.The game is actually quite well optimised. Definitely a better job done on this game than on Blops 3 or Ghosts. It looks beautiful. Some planets look downright stunning and I'm happy to say that I didn't experience any bugs. Voice acting is at top notch quality as well. Every single character is very well voice acted and animated. Listening to Omar and Ethan (my two favourates) was just a joy.Is it worth the full price? Only if you plan to spend a lot of time in the multiplayer or play zombies with friends. The campaign is obviously the strong point of this title but it's not worth spending that much money on a rather linear singleplayer campaign. The only reason this game gets hate is because it's a CoD game. Change the name and people would praise the campaign.
REVIEW IS FOR SINGLE PLAYER CAMPAIGN ONLY - I don't care for 'Hairless Preteen Screaming At You How He's the Hardest Man in His Junior High and He Will F@#$ Your Mother As Soon as He Grows a Pair' modes, didn't play them, don't want to.This is the best Call of Duty single player campaign since Modern Warfare (1).  It's very clear what you're doing and who you're fighting and why - you're not f#Q$ing off to asscrackistan to steal General Olag Rustootskin's left nutsack for Reasons.  Every mission has a clear non-MacGuffin purpose.Just one of the missions:  Fly your fighters in to close Venus orbit, take out all the defending fighters, hammer the enemy battleship's AA till it's safe, grapple to the hull, tether around shooting Space Iranians on the hull, blow a hole in the bridge window to infiltrate, rampage your way down the ship to the armory, wire the place up to blow, then exfiltrate and blow the thing.Yes, there is space combat. It's not the deepest, but it's fun enough and it sure runs better than Star Citizen. The cannon fodder fighters are just lock and lead while firing, but the enemy aces can be a bit of a challenge.  The ground / corridor combat is what you're used to, with some fun interesting upgrades - the spider grenades and 'hacking' where you can turn enemy robots against them (great fun).I had a blast the entire time - I enjoy technical sneaker / shooters like Deus Ex games and Dishonored games, and this is not one of those, but it's Big Dumb Fun and there's a place for that.   And it's gorgeous and you have to love the constant 60 FPS even at 4k.I wouldn't (and didn't) pay $60 for just the single player game, which is about 8-10 hours, but it's well worth $20.
It's a very good Call of Duty game, I know many people feels it's too futuristic and not so real, but I feel it is more fun and not as repetitive than the previous CoD games. The graphics are really nice, and the sooting is very ejoyable. The only two thing I can complain about are: the size (70GB) and the game is too resource hungry, the developers should have spent a little bit more time to optimise this time. If you like war games in the future and you have a good enough PC I can recomend it.

May play a bit different from Black OPS 3, and no VAC in place but once you learn how to rank up it is fun.
campaign 8.5/10 multiplayer is also good
Got this game for a reasonable price and have to say that it was much better than expected.  The campaign is probably the best story that a COD title has produced.  It is full of intense and exciting sequences.  The dogfights are especially impressive and immersive.  Little things such as the main character's hands moving witin the cockpit, switching on all the lights and systems as well as movement of the flight stick etc really help involve you in the experience.  The battles are intense and the sound also helps, with the explosive blasts and engine noise.  This really makes it stand out from previous COD games.  The story is also very good, although Jon Snow isnt in it for much of the time, and it fails to really show the strength of his character and his acting ability  The main character is likeable enough though and his relationship with other characters within the story keeps the narrative flowing.  The rest of the campaign is typical COD. Lots of impressive set pieces and explosions, guns sound punchy enough, and the customisation is a nice touch, usually seen in black ops titles.The only downfall i feel is that the multiplayer isnt up to scratch.  Very difficult to find a decent game, and if you do, you run the risk of cheaters and hackers playing, and it ruins the experience for everyone.  If you can  get this for a good price then i highly recommend it.  The campaign is worth the cost alone. Enjoy :)

Yes.Is this game fun enough and deep enough for an experienced gamer?  Yes as well...
I actually quite liked this game as a Single Player experience. So I'd say: Not worth 60 ´bucks, but I got it together with MW for 40 and I'd say that was a good price for both of them. Personally I would even say IW is a little bit better (but that may be because I like the future setting). The story is quite okay with some very nicely executed scenes and likable, though shamefully underdeveloped, characters. Where would lie my greatest critisism, as they absolutely waste Kit Harrington on a parody of a villain. Seriously. If I was to list all his character traits that would be "having a facial scar" and "being a bastard"(pun intended), as he just has no redeeming quality, no background except maybe 12 lines of info about him on a PC and as far as I know not even a motivation. He wants to conquer earth. That's it. Not even for it's ressources as he constantly reminds you how earth is dying. And the "quotes" you get from the SDF, would only scream "We're the bad guys" more, if they would literally write "We're Nazis and like to punch babies". I mean, it's comical. Despite the critisism, I still enjoyed this 11 hour ride, but story- and character, espeacilly villain wise there is just so much wasted potential.    The space combat is fun, but quite basic as there are only really 3 types of enemies plus the "Aces", which are essentially Hero- units with more health and stronger weapons. The shooting is quite nice and there is a modest variety of guns and gadgets. From time to time you get some nice extra weapon to wreck havoc. But you can't pilot a mech. Which is sad. Although you can always buy Titanfall if you want that, which I would say is the better game, although the story in that felt less interesting. So all in all: If you buy it for the Single Player, wait till it's 20€ or buy it together with MW Remastered if you haven't played that. Not as bad, as you would have thought after the ♥♥♥♥♥torm.

I recommend this game especially if it goes on sale.

I'm still not sure about how I feel regarding Infinite Warfare but Modern Warfare Remastered is just like I remember it when I played it years ago. I only wish there were more people playing so I could enjoy some different game types.
I don't play Call of Duty games for the multiplayer.CoD's mutliplayer experience has... problems. Other people can tell you about those. The reason I buy CoD games is for the campaign, and Infinity Ward knocked it out of the park with IW's campaign.Unlike previous CoD campaigns since MW1, these characters are phenomenal. I actually learned their names within the first two or so missions - unlike other installments where I hadn't learned more than two by the time I'd finished playing. E3N/Ethan is my favorite, just because he's so endearing. But they're all amazing, which makes the events of the campaign that much more well-made. It also does an incredibly good job of NOT GIVING YOU A NEAT TOY AND ONLY LETTING YOU USE IT ONCE. CoD is infamous for this, and IW doesn't really do it at all. I was so very pleased when I found that I could use the cool seeker grenades and the boost mechanics whenever I wanted. This extends to heavy weapons, though those are much harder to rearm mid-level.There's also something I need to get out of the way: FUTURISTIC SHOOTERS ARE NOT A BAD THING. I get that there was the crazy downvote bandwagon for COD:IW when it made its debut reveal. I'm not saying the people who want more grounded shooters are wrong, either - I'd love to see the COD developers switch between Futuristic and Not during different installments - that's one of the upsides to having the franchise produced through several different studios. And not releasing COD4 as a standalone was a horrible idea.The gameplay can feel a little off-putting at times - controls for the Jacakals (the space fighters) aren't great and there are a lot of segments with them, and shootouts in space are frustrating due to how difficult it is to see targets - there's an indicator when you aren't aiming down sights that goes away when you do, and it would have been far better if it were active at both times.But COD:IW is absolutely deserving of your time to thoroughly enjoy the campaign it has to offer. Previous ones have ranged from mediocre to solid (the weakest being Ghosts and the strongest being MW1) but IW tops them all with resounding success - or at the very least comes very, very close to MW1's.As for multiplayer, I've heard nightmare tales of hackers/aimbots all over the place in online play, so I won't be bothering with it.TLDR: Campaign is uniquely exceptional and deserves your time and money, idgaf about multiplayer, it's probably bad. Don't succumb to the downvote bandwagons.
Wish you could upgrade from standard to digital legacy for a smaller amount rather than paying the full amount again.

Another year, another Call of Duty.This is a sentence that I’m sure is said many times over, every winter. The perennial shooter has released a new iteration every year for the past 14 years. This yearly cycle has caused many people to decree that the game is getting stale or that the newest version is “trash” and that the previous year’s was so much better. I tend to disagree with this sentiment more often than not. Now let me start by saying that, unlike the vast majority of people, I play Call of Duty games purely for the campaign. I see it as a cathartic release every year where I can sit back and enjoy their bombastic nature and just have fun.I feel that, for the most part, the Call of Duty games have crafted some genuinely fun campaigns that throw you into some breathtaking set pieces with top notch gunplay. People can rag on the franchise all they want but there is simply no denying that the core mechanics of shooting a gun are rarely topped by another game. This “generation” of Call of Duty games has been a mixed bag for me so far. I thought that Advanced Warfare was the best entry since Modern Warfare 2 and set a high bar for campaigns for the franchise. It also kicked the near-future aesthetic into gear. Then came Black Ops 3 which was such a clear miss in my eyes. The game was a cluttered mess and the narrative was nonsensical at best and babbling drivel at worst. Needless to say, I had my concerns about Infinite Warfare. Luckily, my mind was put to ease since this is one of the best entries in the series.Infinite Warfare continues the motif of a futuristic battlefield and throws the player into a far flung future where the inhabitants of Mars oppose those on Earth. The gunplay is as tight as ever with some really great weapon choices. Add to this the fact that unlike Black Ops 3, shooting robot enemies actually feels impactful and not dull and lifeless. The mission structure is a breath of fresh air as there are actual side missions in the game, whether it be boots on the ground or in a spacecraft. The flying missions are a nice breather between the campaign missions that seem to run at a breakneck pace.Narratively, the game is quite strong. I think for the first time since Modern Warfare I actually remembered characters name’s and felt some sort of an attachment for them. While I’ve mainly enjoyed Call of Duty campaigns, they’re not exactly where I look for great characterization, but Infinite Warfare gives you a team that I actually felt a connection with.I will add that the game also ran quite flawless for me. Running a GTX 970, i5 3570k at 2560x1440, I routinely got upwards of 70 FPS and never dipped below 60 with everything maxed. The game looks and runs marvelously.I greatly enjoyed my time with Infinite Warfare and gives me some encouragement about the direction of the series after the misstep that was Black Ops 3. So while some may bemoan the release of this annualized franchise, I look forward with anticipation that is indeed another year, another Call of Duty.
Edit: The connection problems are apparently fixed, so I changed my review to "Recommended"---Old review----I don't recomed this game, because of the servers and p2p problems, I'm always getting the "Can not migrate host" message, the game worked well the first 2 or 3 weeks but after that is a nightmare to join to an online game . Fortunately I enjoyed the game when it worked, I like the futuristic, fast and frenetic shooters with small maps and this game meet all of those, but the online system just don't work. I will give a try on the next week if the connection problem still appearing I will delete this game forever.--------------------Update 1 12/14/2016: Impossible to join a gameUpdate 2 12/15/2016: Joined an online game but a lot of lag.Update 3 12/16/2016: Working normallyUpdate 4 12/21/2016: Still working well

This game is a surprise from start to finish. The story line is fantastic without being unrealistic. Right from the get-go you feel compelled to continue, and take the fight to the enemy.Regardless of the minor hiccups, overall the graphic quality is exceptional. The in-game control available for post processing etc. is refreshing, and the ability to further quantify your graphic needs by editing the .cfg file is a bonus for PC players not often mentioned. The amount of detail is amazing, right down to the rivets holding the compliance plates on the helmets.The attention to detail to level design and playthrough is very good too. There is an allowable amount of freedom on a set path toward the goal, which is usual for CoD. Freedom of movement in Space combat is exceptional. You won't need to reach for a controller, as the Keyboard/Mouse control feels good. The selection of weapons and attachments (you get more as the game progresses) is nice, and the sounds for each weapon feels right. The Devs made the usual mistake of 'Space Noise', but it seems to be a common theme in games today.On a sour note, Infinity Ward opted for the 'Push Through' combat style of play typical for consoles. It works like this:When (as in real life combat) you encounter the enemy, you assess the situation, receive information from the team and quickly decide the best course of action. And this is when 'Push Through' comes into play.If you stay put, wave after wave of enemy advance toward you, and your team members suddenly forget how to aim. BUT, if you rush toward the enemy, shooting only what you need too, your team will miraculously finish off anything you pass.This means you only need to run forward, ducking and weaving, and advance to the next checkpoint. There are no penalties for doing this, except missing out on a more realistic fire-fight. The upshot for the Devs is you finish the game quickly, so you’re ready to buy the next one. The combat lacks strategy, planning, and a realistic use of cover and landscape. Overall, the Single Player rates as follows;Story: 9/10Graphics: 9/10Sound: 9/10Combat: 3/10If you want a review for multiplayer, just read through all the negative recommendations. They're not exactly reviews, more criticisms than anything else. Viewer Discretion Advised.Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha. I could do that for hours!You  sad-sacks make me laugh! Most you , and you  have the hide to complain. Ha ha ha ha.Go and [s]upgrade[/s] buy a . NOT a laptop. NOT a Harvey Rip-off. A REAL PC. A system BUILT to spec by a TECH.THEN, play the game - and tell me about any REAL problems you have. Then I'll listen to you...and I suspect, so will the DEVS

I have been playing Call of Duty since the beginning, there's been great games (the original, obviously, Modern Warfare, Black Ops 2) and there's been some god-awful games (Ghosts and Advanced Warfare). This game is actually pretty decent, it may not raise to the level of greatness like Modern Warfare or BLOPS 2 but its enjoyable and keeps me coming back for more despite it's downfalls.While I haven't finished the single-player campaign (I'm more of a multiplayer gamer now-a-days), what I have played is thoroughly enjoyable but it would have been nice if they had incorporated cooperative gameplay in (even if it was only with one other player).I enjoy the Zombies mode, it adds a nice change of pace and lets you play something cooperatively with friends, they didn't change the formula too much from the previous games but just enough to where it didn't feel like the same exact thing as the others. My biggest complaint with this mode is it takes friggin' forever to level up weapons.Multiplayer is enjoyable. It's the normal fast-paced run and gun gameplay that we all know and love from Call of Duty. The movement system feels right. It's not too slow and not too fast and the added movements (double-jump, wallrunning, etc etc) don't feel forced. The maps are well designed and being able to play on terminal once again is amazing. The weapons seemed balanced and the quartermaster upgrades offer nice additions but don't offer any absurd advantages over someone using a stock weapon.I have three big complaints about the multiplayer. The first being the player base, there's just not enough people playing the game but I understand. PC gamers are tired of getting screwed by Activision over this series. The second is that there are no dedicated servers, at all. I realize that seeing a server browser with custom servers probably isn't going to happen in Call of Duty again (maybe in a Treyarch CoD, since those devs actually seem to like us) but the fact that they're using peer-to-peer connections is ridiculous. It clearly gives the host player an advantage, on several occasions I've noticed shots not registering on a certain player. The third ridiculous thing that they (Infinity Ward and Activision) decided to not do for this game is to include any type of active anti-cheat measures, no VAC, no Punkbuster, no Fairfight, no Battleeye, nothing. I have little doubt that #2 and #3 are the responsible for #1. If Infinity Ward will fix those two problems, I think this game would probably be one of the better releases in recent years.Despite its flaws though, I still enjoy the game and still can recommend it to other players.

ถือว่าเป็นเกมที่กระแสแรง(ด้านลบ)ตั้งแต่เกมยังไม่ออกเลยทีเดียว อันเนื่องมาจากการเปลี่ยนธีมที่หลุดออกนอกอวกาศเลยทีเดียว บอกตามตรงแรกๆ ก็ชักหวั่นว่าตัวเกมจะออกมาดีไหม จะมีปัญหา จุกจิก เรื่องการพอท อีกไหม แต่เมื่อตัวเกมออกและได้เล่น เนื้อเรื่องจนจบ บอกเลยว่า ไม่ผิดหวัง บางคนอาจมองว่า ทำไมตัวเกมหลุดออกนอกอวกาศ แต่ เพราะการหลุดออกนอกอวกาศของภาคนี้ ทำให้มีเนื้อหาใหม่ๆ ที่ไม่ใช้แค่ตามล่าผู้ก่อการร้ายบนพื้นดิน แต่ ตามล่ากันในอวกาศ มีมิซซั่น ยิบย่อยให้ทำ การขับเครื่องบินไล่ยิงทำได้ดี สนุกกว่าที่ผ่านๆมา ถ้าลองคิดเล่นๆ ทีมงานทำ Ghost 2 แทน Infinite Warfare บอกเลยว่า คงน่าเบื่อกว่าที่จะยึดติดกับอะไรเดิมๆ โดยไม่คิดอะไรใหม่ๆ ถือว่าการออกนอกอวกาศครั้งนี้ตัดสินใจถูกแล้ว ด้านเนื้อเรื่อง [ดีมาก] ออกมาตามแบบฉบับ คอล ออฟ ดิ้วตี้ ที่ใครๆก็รู้ว่า เน้นจุดนี้มาก แม้หลายอย่างจะสามารถเดาทางได้ แต่ ไม่ต้องห่วงว่าจะไม่มีอะไรตื่นตา ในภาคนี้จะได้เจอฉากใหม่ๆอลังการ ระเบิด หรือ ของเล่นใหม่ๆ การดำเนินเรื่องเหมือนได้ดูหนังเรื่องหนึ่ง  ด้านเสียง [ดี] เสียงปืนซีรีย์นี้เริ่มพัฒนามาได้ดีตั้งแต่ ซีรีย์ Ghost ที่เริ่มมีความหนักแน่น ให้เห็น แม้จะมีหลายคน อคติ บอกก๊องแก๊ง แต่ถ้ามองโดยรวม ถือว่าดีกว่าเกมยิงโดยทั่วไปอยู่แล้ว ไม่นับ ซีรีย์คู่แข่งที่ทำเสียงออกมาดีมาก เสียงรายละเอียดต่างๆทำออกมาดีด้านกราฟฟิค [ดีมาก] เป็นสิ่งที่กลัวที่สุดของซีรีย์นี้คือการพอทมาแบบลวกๆ ซึ่งตอนเล่นครั้งแรกมีอาการ สกรีน ฟรีซ หรือพูดคร่าวๆ คือ เฟรมเรทสูง แต่มีจังหวะชะงัก ให้เสียอารมณ์ แต่พอเล่นไปได้ระดันหนึ่งอาการจะหายไป เอนจิ้น ยังคงซดทรัพยากรไปเต็มที่ ชนิดที่กินทุกอย่างที่มี ไม่ว่าจะเป็น Ram Vram พี่แกซดจนเกม BF1 ยังอาย แต่ก็ไม่เป็นปัญหาอะไร เพราะมันก็จะกินตามที่เรามีมีน้อยก็กินเกลี้ยง มีมากก็กินเกลี้ยง ไม่ต่างกัน แต่ภาพที่ได้ สวยงาม แสงเงา จัดเต็ม  จนแทบไม่มีคำว่า ซีรีย์นี้ภาพกาก อีกแล้ว หลังจากที่ผ่านมาจุดนี้โดนโจมตีบ่อยมัลติเพลเยอร์ [ปรับปรุง] นี้คงเป็นจุดเดียว ที่บอกได้ว่าน่าผิดหวัง ตัวเกมขาดสมดุลอย่างมาก และเน้นเกมเร็วจนขาดความสนุก อารมณ์ที่เล่นคือนี้ใช้ คอล ออฟ ดิ้วตี้ หรอ มันแปลกๆ ไม่ได้หมายถึง แปลกที่ มันเป็น อวกาศอะไร แต่แปลกที่ระบบ ต่างๆ เช่นการมีขีด HP เวลายิง เกมพยายามใส่ อาวุธพิเศษเข้ามาแบบ แบลคออฟ 3 แต่หลายอย่างดูไร้ความจำเป็นมาก และหลายอย่างก็โกงมากๆ บวกกับการมาแพคคู่กับ โมเดิรน วอแฟร์ รีมาสเตอร์ ทำให้ หลายคนเข้าไปหวด ตัวรีมาสเตอร์มากกว่า เพราะได้กลิ่นอายภาคเดิมๆ และถูกใจคนที่ไม่ชอบ การสู้แบบ ปีนปาย กระโดดสับ ได้ดี (ผมก็เป็นหนึ่งในนั้น)สรุป การมาของ ภาคตะลุยอวกาศ นี้ ถือว่า สวนกระแสด้านลบเลยทีเดียว ซึ่งจริงๆ หลายคนก็คงทราบดีอยู่แล้ว ว่าเกมออกมาดีแน่นอน แต่ด้วยความอนุรักษ์นิยม ประมาณ เห้ย ขอเป็นหน่วยซีล เดินป่า ตามล่า ผู้ก่อการร้าย ได้ไหม ตรูไม่อยากไปอวกาศ ก็เลยอคติไปหน่อย และดูท่าทางผู้พัฒนา ก็คงรู้จุดนี้ดีจึงออก ภาครีมาสเตอร์มาล่อด้วย (รึเปล่า) ก็ทำให้คนที่อยากเล่นตัวรีมาสเตอร์ซื้อ แต่เชื่อว่า พอได้ลองเล่น ภาค ตะลุยอวกาศ ก็คงอุทานในใจว่า มันไม่ได้เลวร้ายเลยนี้หว่า ดังคำกล่าวที่ว่า ช้างตายทั้งตัว เอาใบบัวปิดไม่ชิด ไม่ช่ายยละ ดังคำกล่าวที่ว่า สิ่งที่เรากลัว ไม่ใช้การทำอะไรเดิม แต่เป็น การขาดอะไรใหม่ๆ มากกว่า

Isn't pay2win for now so... 8/10
I've played every other CoD game and I used to play them in the majority of my spare time. In my opinion, Infinite Warfare's precursor, Advanced Warfare, was fun and innovative but it had its flaws, then they ruined it with constant buffs and nerfs until everything was extraordinarily broken. This game feels like it has the same potential. With the same weapon variant system as AW had, I wouldn't be surprised if it ended up going down the same road. However, it has very fluid movement and it's more intuitive than AW was. This game is surprisingly fun, and I've been having more fun playing it than I expected. But, there is one prevalent issue that I can only assume will get worse over time. From the very first few games I already encountered a blatant hacker. It ruins the experience for that game but I haven't been meeting a lot. However, for the short time that I've been playing the game it's been too many hackers than what one should meet. Overall, the game is fun but it has a potential to end up poorly if the devs treat it the same way they did with Advanced Warfare, and the cheating can only get worse from here on out unless they implement an anti-cheat system.PROS: - It's very fun for a non-traditional CoD shooter - The weapons feel both familiar and new  - Innovative but still feels like a CoD game - Stunning visuals - Very nice audio  - Maps are mostly fun, some are meh but that's mostly opinion based Not sure what else you'd want to hear about a Call of Duty game, other than "Yes, it's fun"CONS: - Some of the character class types seem like they're a little unbalanced with other types - Currently there's a huge potental for cheating - Weapon variant system might end badlyOTHER COMMENTS: - The weapon "Loot Box" system is good now, but I'm pretty sure they're making the boxes purchasable soon. I'm not a fan of this because it encourages a pay-to-win mentality, especially since most weapon variants are earned through the boxes. However, for the time being, the loot boxes are earned through gameplay and it's fine.All in all, this game is fun. Much more than I expected it to be. If the developers can take care of it, I think it will last. However, it has some crucial cracks and flaws that can only inevitably get bigger if they aren't fixed.
This game is most likely one of the best COD games Ive played, but I still like COD2 Best alot better. I'd rather buy the game for $200 than buy this!
13 hours for single player CoD is something outstanding, based on statistic for other games in the series.I haven't played other CoD games, but MW1, hence can't say out of my moma's basement that 'I'm so bored with this super top-notch show quality  everty year, jez'. But it's truly amazing, even Michal Bay doesn't make anything good as this. On other hand it has horrible gameplay. I wasn't aware of 'RPG' element, therefore beginning of it is pretty rough but it gets better towards the end. Is more modern style at the end of the game. Two Akimbo shotguns at the Mars Shipyard is priceless.13 hours for $15 is kind of 'ok-ish' price for provided quality, since I have no interest in the rest on content (multiplayer and zombies). Activision should learn how to split prices for Single, Multiplayer, Co-op and they will have much more customers, instead forcing people to buy whole package for full price and getting negatives because of 'same and bad multiplayer' as based on comments/reviews.

this game is good, zombies is the best part. wost thing is that you cant get anyother game modes on multiplayer except team deathmatch in aus due to servers
Note: This is a recommendation purely for the campaign - As of writing this I have not played the multiplayer or zombies as I am not really a fan of the way either have progressed in recent entries of the franchiseJust to get the negatives out of the way there are some issues that are plaguing the game (apparently a lot of multiplayer ones but as I said, I haven't touched it so I can't really comment) but as far as my experience goes, there was nothing gamebreaking. The worst I had was the cutscenes (the pre-rendered ones not in-game ones) being choppy and having the audio out of sync. It did take me out of the experience momentarily but I got over it quickly. Also, the marketing; the first trailer on the store page shows what looks like a typical gung-ho dude-bro story and a lot of the other marketing materials support this view of the game but I found it to be anything but! On the contrary, it was genuinely a more serious and at times more emotional story with a lot of effort put in. Other than the above annoyances I was kind of blown away by the campaign and I am more than happy to give IW a recommendation on that alone! Infinity Ward have really redeemed themselves in my eyes as far as narrative and gameplay go. For anyone who wishes CoD would evolve, innovate or do something new, this is it! This is the game that did an awful lot of new things for the series!+ Optional Side Missions+ Zero-Gravity fights+ Space Fighter Combat+ Memorable and diverse characters (Seriously, of all the main cast, there was not one forgetable or throwaway one)+ Hugely varied environments+ Oddly good quiet/subtle/reflective moments (wasn't expecting that from a CoD game)+ Small boss fights+ A compelling narrative+ Stuff I am probably missingHonestly, I feel like this has been the best CoD campaign in a while and it may have just become my favourite. Not since Black Ops 2 has a CoD game successfully done something so different to the regular formula. I can genuinely say that the game provided me with some unique experiences! To say more than this would venture too close to spoiler territory, both for the narrative and for the gameplay. I managed to pick this up on the cheap during a cyber monday sale and it was well worth the money spent, but while I have almost nothing but good things to say about it I can't ignore the fact that the current price of £39.99 is still a lot for a roughly 8 hour campaign (completed on regular). My advice would be this, please don't forget this game if yoy enjoy FPS campaigns, instead wait for it to go on sale for about £20 or less and then give it a go, I promise you will not be disappointed and I would love to see more of this storytelling and gameplay innovation in future titles!

So,i don't understand this world sometimes.I have played every single COD game(except AW) and i can say,that this game doesn't deserve the hate it gets.Listen up,guys.This game is the best COD new era game.(I mean the best sci-fi exo jump COD game).The Infinity Ward team has put a lot of effort into this and i respect that.I won't be part of the hate majority.I will tell you my reasons why i think that IW is even better than BO3.Disclaimer:If you have already played BO3 and AW both,you won't enjoy this game as much as i enjoy it.But now listen up.I have played BO3 but only for like 2-3 hours and i can say that this game easily beats it.If you are like me,who has almost no knowledge in exo suits,you will enjoy this game.Now it's time for the real review:Singleplayer:This will probably be my longest review on Steam,just because i want to put end to this injustice.This game is amazing.No,really it is.I will start with the best thing about this game.The story.Absolutely fantastic.I can't even describe how i feel.As i said,i have played almost all COD campaigns(this includes all the ww2 COD games,Ghosts,BO2 and the MW games).This game comes just after my favourite MW franchise.I won't spoil the story,but i will only say that you just MUST complete it,as well as consider completing the side missions,because they aren't what you probably think they are. All of them are completely different and don't get boring.That's the awesome thing about this game.COD:IW also feels very lively.The game has a bit of freeroam opportunities around the ship and it is very cool to see the that Infinity Ward are adding this small details to make the game feel more realistic.I like the fact,that the game is made like a movie.Your character has  a very cool personality(unlike the mw series for example,where some of the playable characters have no history behind them).The cutscenes are also really cool.I really enjoy watching them.I also feel attached to some of the characters,thanks to their positive personality.The voice acting is very good as well.I can say many other positive things about the campaign,but i will leave the rest for the reader of this review to discover.Multiplayer:Well,it's good.The gameplay is cool.The killstreaks are reskins like in every other COD game,so i can't say anything special about them.The cool thing i noticed were the maps.They are astonishing.I really like playing on them.The weapons are really cool actually.I thought they were gonna look like♥♥♥♥♥♥but some of them are really beatiful looking(im talking about the NV4 here).The first thing the player will notice when creating his class in multiplayer will be that the weapons are look like a futuristic version of old COD games.Some of the weapons aren't even changed.They look exactly the same(for example the ump-45 or the so called mactac-45 in IW).The game isn't p2w imo.Yeah,getting an epic weapon from supply drops has it's advantages,but it can be countered if you are a skillful player.I still don't like the supply drop system.I forgot the mention the return of the nuke.Sadly,i haven't witnessed someone getting it,because it is even harder to get than before.Zombies:I haven't played and can't say anything.I will say only that i'm a big fan of the 80s (Hotline Miami is one of my favourite games and i really like movies like Kung Fury,Terminator,Drive).Why am i saying that?Well,i have watched some gameplay of the zombies and it seems like they are set in a theme park in an alternative 80s universe.So yeah,maybe the gamemode is cool.I will update my review as soon as (or if) I start playing them.Final Verdict:8/10 (the review is only for IW,even though i like MWR more,i will update my review to include my opinion on the remaster as soon as the developers fix the stuttering problems)

Guess I still have the chance to get to lv1000 in Black Ops 3.Game is not bad, if only they still remember they actually launched the game on PC too.===================2017.10.31 Re-review=====================After leaving this game in the dust for 9 months, I decided to pick it up, mostly driven by its zombies mode. To be honest, the zombies installment for IW is very ambitious, and is well made and directed. I do follow the mode's lead Lee Ross, and he is passionate about this game. His passion is well reflected in the game mode, and I have to give the pros for it.But I also have to write about the zombies mode and the zombies mode alone. Sure it's got a lot of potential, but may definately be better. Story wise, the story is designed but not performed well. It feels very weak and unrelated throughout the gameplay. Character quotes are not intriguing and strong enough to even think about the implication. The overall scheme is barely comprehendable. Hopefully that would become better in the next game.Gameplay wise, it is really hard to write about. I just feel something "OFF" but I can't really put it into words. The mode is indeed difficult but not feeling in a correct way. There are sure a lot to explore but they are so distant from the core gameplay that might interest people. Again I feel like I am not qualified to write too much about it, as I didn't play the game enough to actually get the judgement.Last I would like to touch on how they close off Extinction in this zombies mode. It feels refreshing to hear about the mode again yet, they finished it too generally. In The Beast From Beyond, it was explained that Extinction is a series of Wyler's films, and that this map is a "re-write" of Nightfall. But that doesn't come to a solid explanation in the game. There are radios explaining the event post Exodus, but that feels quite unsatisfying, and that's it. I am pretty neutral on how they have done telling the Extinction story, but I know many Extinction core players aren't any happy with it.Overall, an ambitious game, born too late, or born too early. I slightly feel sorry for Infinity Ward.

In my opinion, if you liked Call of Duty: Black Ops III, you'll most definitely enjoy IW.  It's basically a carbon copy except has better framerates, better graphics, and a faster key system (at least in my playthroughs.)  The zombies mode is fun but can quickly get repetitive, campaign I haven't touched, and the multiplayer for the most part is fantastic.  Solid 8/10

Wow.Fight with Modern weapons in space like in Shattered Horizon. Fly space fighter jets, fight drones with electronic grenades, jump boosts to get to hard places, horizontal wall walking, play as a captain of a space battlecruiser. Although not like Mass Effect 2, Infinite Warfare tries to open up to open-world like campaign.TL;DR the initial part is scripted, the second part is more selective with pre-scripted battles like in Dawn of War 3.
Tahle hra má dvá tábory hráčské populace. Ti co jí milují jsou jejími obránci a ti co jí nesnášejí... no jí prostě nesnášejí. Já jsem se zázrakem dostal do středu, kde je jen málo lidí. Hrál jsem takřka všechny díly COD od jedniček (Mimo Black Ops 1, Advanced Warfare a BO3) a u tohoto dílu mám následující názor: Hratelnost je více než dobrá a akce rychlá jako obvykle. Zklamalo mě akorát létání a chození po zdech... tohle si mohli odpustit. Tématika a originalita příběhu je už ovšem horší a nemluvě o délce kampaně. Této hře bych dal tak 6/10. Nevidím v ní hru roku, ale zase se nedá zahazovat k tomu nejhoršímu.

Az űrben senki sem hallja majd a sikolyodA legújabb Call of Duty követi a trendet,és az űrbe kalauzolja el a playert."Űr,Ó te Messzi messzi"Kampány.Multi.Zombik.Az esetek többségében az űrben fogunk harcolni a kampányrésszel ami olyan 8+ egynéhány órát tesz ki (mint egy alap CoD) A multiplayer java része is ittjátszódik mint ahogy az lenni szokott.A pályák szépen kidolgozottak,sőt az MW2 remasterizált Terminál is nagyot üt."Szóval a legújabb COD olyan mint egy Warframe" (vnorberto065)Igaza volt voltaképp max annyiban hogy 'Salvage'k  gyűjtésével egy jobb fegyvervariánst kraftolhatunk -igen WarframeEzeket a 30-as láda fogja dobni,és változó mennyiségű lehet.Kék láda egyszerűség kedvéért.Vagyis inkább a normál láda kártyát,célzót ruhát a kék láda az esetek többségében rare vagy jobb fegyvervariánst ad aminek van 1-2 tulajdonsága mint pl.: 25 ölésért atomot dob a pályára.Ezek mondjuk jók,de nagyon nehéz 25-öt ölni hogy meg nem halsz hacsak nem csalszAz gránátok és egyéb eszközök is inkább valami modern scifire hasonlítanak mintsem egy II.világháborúra.A fekete lyuk generátor például jópofa.A többi eszköz mint pl a dobókés most nemcsak dobó,de egyben robbanó is.Jók ezek bár ha semmi hasznuk sincs mondjuk van 1-2 jó de a többi fölösnek érzem.Most az hogy a gránátot dobom vagy repítem szerintem tökmindegy sebezzen azt kész.A lehívható eszközök között is akad jónáhány ami érdekes de nagyrészük drága és lehívni lehetetlen hacsak nem csalsz valahogy.Ami használható a Dróndoboz,A T.H.O.R. és a Wardenre keresztelt légijármű a többi hülyeségnek tartom.A Mission Teamek a kampányból átvett csapatok akiket szintenként unlockolhatunk,és körönként adnak egy kihívást aminek teljesítéséért szintet lép az egységünk -OMG 0oRiget nekem de azonnyombanA rigek azok a karakterek akiket szintenként unlockolhatunk,és van 1-2 tulajdonságuk.Az egység szintenként dob ruhát,sisakot hozzá.A fegyverek is inkább valami modern scifire hajaznak,mintha ez valami III.világháború lenne.Assault,SMG,LMG, satöbbi energia formátumban.Mondjuk a Classic kategóriás Garandot bírtam az valami isteni Zombik- maradj lent fel sem kelj ( A L I E N™  Dying Light)Egy űrvidámparkban harcolunk az élőhalottak ellen négy egyetemista valamelyikével.A harcunkat segítik különféle eszközök és kraftolható eszközök ez mind a 80-as években.Az easter egg piszoknehéz 3 órás kaland ufókkal is.Új,Év Új CoD-tartja a mondás  jó ez a scifi lövölde de csak énérzem hogy ebből 26. már kicsit unalmas.Csak annak ajánlom aki szereti a Codot másnak nem csapatban jó tolni a többi hasznavehetetlen gyök meg már unalmas.Én codon nőttem fel és ez ígyvan rendjén de ami már végképp hülyeség  hogy a ládákat kulcsért nyithatjuk és nem körönként vagy ölésért adja.Kulcsot kör végén ad csak.Ráadásul a normál láda
