I'm just going to list a few thoughts when comparing Infinite Warfare to Black Ops III:- Movement in multiplayer is slightly slower than Black Ops III, the jump seems weaker but longer. - The maps are slightly less well balanced, but look more believeable and feel immersive.- The game engine is very smooth and solid, the animations look better, and character models have weight.- All game loadscreens seem about 10x quicker, and I can boot the game into the lobby in less than a minute.- Match making seems a little worse, with a little bit of a wait to get into a match.- All menus are very simple and streamlined, and only require a few clicks to find things.- The Zombies map and theme is a a little too light-hearted, but the gameplay is very tight.- The space setting feels kind of the same as BO3, but slightly more realistic, but maybe less cyber-punk.- The crates and 'scrap' feel far more generous to me and I earn a rare crate every few hours of play.- Not sure whether I prefer the new 'rigs' over the 'specialists' but you can swap your 'rig' mid game which adds strategy.

So Call of Duty recieves flak for so much. Often its lack of inovation or doing anything new. Then when they do they get flak for not being like Call of Duty. reviews either say "f you like CoD youll probably like it". This time it really felt like they had put in a ton of effort to break the mold.Ill start with the bad. It doesnt get on well with AVG and I had to mess around adding it to the exceptions list before it would even function.Right bad stuff over on to the cool.Graphics are stunning. characters look like their actors and scenery is awesome running on an I5 4690K and RX480 8gb ram. Story was gripping to me and had me till the end.Gameplay for me was the best bit. Kept the standard CoD frame work then added loads to it. Flight sections, multi funtions on the weapons, the ability to hack enemies (I know BO3 had it but that one sucked so I dont care).And as an added bonus the sound track was really cool.No idea YET about the multiplayer or zombies. ill look at them later but I rarely give either mode a look in on any CoD game so not bothered.Check it out. It really is worth it.
So,i don't understand this world sometimes.I have played every single COD game(except AW) and i can say,that this game doesn't deserve the hate it gets.Listen up,guys.This game is the best COD new era game.(I mean the best sci-fi exo jump COD game).The Infinity Ward team has put a lot of effort into this and i respect that.I won't be part of the hate majority.I will tell you my reasons why i think that IW is even better than BO3.Disclaimer:If you have already played BO3 and AW both,you won't enjoy this game as much as i enjoy it.But now listen up.I have played BO3 but only for like 2-3 hours and i can say that this game easily beats it.If you are like me,who has almost no knowledge in exo suits,you will enjoy this game.Now it's time for the real review:Singleplayer:This will probably be my longest review on Steam,just because i want to put end to this injustice.This game is amazing.No,really it is.I will start with the best thing about this game.The story.Absolutely fantastic.I can't even describe how i feel.As i said,i have played almost all COD campaigns(this includes all the ww2 COD games,Ghosts,BO2 and the MW games).This game comes just after my favourite MW franchise.I won't spoil the story,but i will only say that you just MUST complete it,as well as consider completing the side missions,because they aren't what you probably think they are. All of them are completely different and don't get boring.That's the awesome thing about this game.COD:IW also feels very lively.The game has a bit of freeroam opportunities around the ship and it is very cool to see the that Infinity Ward are adding this small details to make the game feel more realistic.I like the fact,that the game is made like a movie.Your character has  a very cool personality(unlike the mw series for example,where some of the playable characters have no history behind them).The cutscenes are also really cool.I really enjoy watching them.I also feel attached to some of the characters,thanks to their positive personality.The voice acting is very good as well.I can say many other positive things about the campaign,but i will leave the rest for the reader of this review to discover.Multiplayer:Well,it's good.The gameplay is cool.The killstreaks are reskins like in every other COD game,so i can't say anything special about them.The cool thing i noticed were the maps.They are astonishing.I really like playing on them.The weapons are really cool actually.I thought they were gonna look like♥♥♥♥♥♥but some of them are really beatiful looking(im talking about the NV4 here).The first thing the player will notice when creating his class in multiplayer will be that the weapons are look like a futuristic version of old COD games.Some of the weapons aren't even changed.They look exactly the same(for example the ump-45 or the so called mactac-45 in IW).The game isn't p2w imo.Yeah,getting an epic weapon from supply drops has it's advantages,but it can be countered if you are a skillful player.I still don't like the supply drop system.I forgot the mention the return of the nuke.Sadly,i haven't witnessed someone getting it,because it is even harder to get than before.Zombies:I haven't played and can't say anything.I will say only that i'm a big fan of the 80s (Hotline Miami is one of my favourite games and i really like movies like Kung Fury,Terminator,Drive).Why am i saying that?Well,i have watched some gameplay of the zombies and it seems like they are set in a theme park in an alternative 80s universe.So yeah,maybe the gamemode is cool.I will update my review as soon as (or if) I start playing them.Final Verdict:8/10 (the review is only for IW,even though i like MWR more,i will update my review to include my opinion on the remaster as soon as the developers fix the stuttering problems)

The MP is good and lag compensation is not bad like some are saying. The maps and style does need getting used to but after that it is a very fun game. Thought it was going to be bad, but It's one of the best COD games i have ever played!!
I see a lot of reviews about the multiplayer. I haven't touched that, but if you check those other reviews, I imagine they're accurate: lots of cheaters/hackers about, the playerbase has been split between the Windows Store and Steam (wtf were you thinking Activision) so there aren't many players outside of hte main game modes. I've never really enjoyed the MP element of CoD games, so all that stuff doesn't bother me much.The aspect I've always liked is the SP campaigns. I've enjoyed almost every single one since CoD4, and this one's among the best. You can choose your weapon loadouts, every mission adds a perk that can be a bit of a gamechanger, and you can choose which missions you do at what times. The story is pretty good, I think - there are some elements that could've been better explored (like why is everyone instantly over Ethan being a robot), but I like the characters, and the missions are all really fun.The space combat is good too. You've been able to control vehicles in past CoD games, but your control was always super limited. It's nowhere near as limited in IW. You control a Jackal, which is basically an all-rounder of a jet. It can do space things and it can do atmosphere things. You actually have a lot of control over the aircraft when you're in it - there are invisible walls to the battlefield, but the game does a good job at keeping you where it wants you to be without forcing you to be there.The graphics are pretty good. They coudl be be better in some places, like the gun textures just look a bit blocky, but overall, it's passable. Some of the setpieces look awesome, especially in that first mission where aircraft are constantly falling out of the sky.If you're like me and you only care about the campaign, this is a good one. Pick it up on a sale sometime.
Call of Duty Infinite Warfare boasts a solid campaign (while on the short side) in addition to fun zombies (as always) and well-rounded multiplayer. The story of Infinite Warfare is a lot like the original Modern Warfare, just with space terrorists and lasers and spaceships. The campaign takes you all around our solar system (mainly Mars Earth and the moon, other planets are orbitted by space stations which fights take place on in single player and multiplayer) and has a quite cliche but also likeable james bond esc villain. Not anything special, but he's cool overall. The player takes control of John Everyman (joking) who is put in a bad position after his commanding officer is killed by the bad guys forces (called the Settlement Defense Front or SDF) and he must take over and defend earth. Your partner in crime, Lieutenant Fullyclothed Butstillsexy is the token woman soldier in the plot but is still a fine character overall, she doesn't feel hammed in in any way to keep the SJWs at bay. Which is always a plus nowadays in such a politically correct world. So basically you try to stop the SDF from taking over Earth after they have succesfully invaded other planets in our solar system. As for multiplayer the game sports the general Assault, SMG, LMG, Shotgun and Sniper categories, but also includes a "classic" category which takes some of the best weapons from previous Call of Duty's past such as the Intervention and Ump 45 which rival the futurisitic weapons in the game. New to the series are particle beam or "energy" weapons which use patricle beams to deal damage in a multitude of different manners, some hit hard but have huge recoil, others have high fire rates and deadly accuracy but suffer in terms of damage. A lot like the ballistic firearms then, eh? Well the energy weapons also sport various attachments specific to them, some which mimic the effects of the ballistic weapon's equivilents, some completely unique to energy weapons. The energy weapons, other than visuallly and sonically, aren't that different to the ballistic weapons, but still sport their own advantages and disadvantages, adding more ways to play the game. As for weapons all together, shotguns are horribly overshadowed by the SMGs, and snipers, with their slow scope times and often gimmiky firing effects, leave them much less effective than the long-range assault rifles this time around. However with a few attachments snipers can often be succesful with good aim, but shotguns just stand no chance to the SMGs, the CQB SMGs simply do more damage more of the time than the Shotguns. Funnily enough, the debatably best shotgun, the Reaver, is the first Shotgun avalible to you. The jetpacking is smooth and feels nice but it's more restrictive than in Advanced Warfare and Black Ops 3, likely to stop people from usig stealth perks and jetpacking to unsportsmanlike camping positions, which i feel is fair. Rigs, the equivilant of specialists from Black Ops 3, are no longer individual character, but are rather suits of armor with their own sets of abilities. Rigs no longer have just 2 payloads, they have 3 payloads to choose from and 3 passive abiltiies (abiltieis that you spawn with) to choose from, offering great variation. Maps are your basic CQB call of duty maps with large areas and corridors splashed in there, think black ops 2 but less camping possibilities. Now, the elephant in the room, supply drops and variants. All guns have a set of variants which give the gun its own set of abilities to help you hit harder, or run faster, or make you more stable, etc, basically 1-2 free attachments varying on how rare the varient is. The problem is that you mainly get these from supply drops, which are opened by keys which are earned by playing. However, you can also open them by paying real money, so you can pay for a very powerful version of an already good gun. The drops are random but if rare supply drops are bought there is a good chance of getting a good variant, so that is quite lame. But still, if you can earn them, it's not that big a deal.As for zombies, well it's not not really my thing so i won't go on about it. I don't want to give anything away but this version of zombies is funny,radical, interesting, and implements the best from the old and the best from the new. Solid overall, i'll probably get the DLC.Call of Duty Infinite Warfare is a good game overall. While not for everyone with it's fast paced, jetpack/wallrunning focused movement as well as the staple low health pool of the player in multiplayer, it is a fine addition of the Call of Duty series. If you liked Black Ops 3/Advanced Warfare's mechanics, you'll love Infinite Warfare, as it draws from both games in the best ways possible. Singleplayer is intrigueing and fun as well, with plenty of cliches but also plenty of action. Supply Drops and variants leave a nasty aftertaste in my mouth, but the bite itself is ever so sweet. 8/10
i boght the game for the singleplayer;and i got what I wanted .the campaign is amazing and i liked it very much.the multyplayer ? nahh...to me it look pretty much the same as the previus games  [and yea ,i got them all]
OK.I honestly really liked IW. Campaign is one of the best in years for the CoD series, and Zombies is great! (I almost prefer IW zombies over treyarch now) And it runs amazingly and is very well optimized.The multiplayer is fun at stages, but very similar to Black Ops 3. IW actively supports the playerbase too, such as adding new FREE maps and such, but they don't give a♥♥♥♥♥♥about PC players.Why?Well, They have no Anticheat (The game isn't overrun with hackers like most reviews say, you'll encounter one like every 20-30 matches).They also are keeping a ton of game modes from us that they can put in PC, as they're already on mosh pit, (Search and Destroy, Kill Confirmed, etc.) but nobody plays mosh pit so idk.The playerbase is dead too. The only modes you're going to find people on is Team Deathmatch and Hardpoint, so no gun game or anything for you unless you get a bunch of friends to go online.Also, they haven't added CoD points or anything, but that's probalby a good thing for most people.One thing I wanted to address too, they actually have dedicated servers on this one and that's very rare for a CoD PC port. No server list like World at War though.So, is the game worth it?I say yes!!! BUT only at a sale price. It's gone down to $40 a couple of times, and I've even seen it go down to $20 and $30 on newegg and amazon. Definitely pick it up at that pricetag if you're curious about it. If you're only going to be playing multiplayer though, I'd say wait for it to drop to $20 or $30.What's better though, is to get the Digital Deluxe edition. Comes with IW, MWR, and the season pass and it regularly drops to $80. That's going to be your best price if you want to put the time into playing it. Sadly, I bought it standalone and I have to pay another $60-$80 to play MWR because Activision's business scheme is♥♥♥♥♥♥ Excited to see what comes from the DLCs though.Overall...The entire game is a 8/10 for me.Campaign: 9/10Zombies: 10/10Multiplayer: 6.5/10Thanks, and don't ♥♥♥♥ing hate me for giving this a good review lol.

Great Singleplayer and zombie mode.
Overall enjoyable single player campaign, but it has some pretty questionable moments. It feels like it doesn't try too hard. But there are definitely some awe-inspiring scenes, and the design of the weapons, ships and robots is outstanding. The campaign progression is similar to newer COD games, but I get the feeling they wanted to borrow something from the Mass Effect series. You can choose the missions you want to do, side missions or main campaign as commander of the ship, interact with people or objects, but there are so little options they shouldn't have bothered.I haven't touched the multiplayer since I'm not interested in it, but the Zombies mode seems cool after messing with it a bit.
The breeze of fresh air the COD brand needed! Awesome gameplay, including lots of dogfighting, side missions, a real proactive and talkative protagonist, battles on a local and epic scale, gorgeous environments... This is the beginning of a new glorious era for COD.

Like previous Call of Duty titles. Only, in space this time. Script and storytelling hits new lows. Would win hands-down if award for "Worst-Written Antagonist of All Time" was being handed out. Strongly suspect that the people who make these games are starting to resent having to churn these things out regularly, and it's starting to show in the product.Space combat, while initially looking promising, is basically an extraordinarily simple arcade subgame that doesn't reach anywhere near the potential of the genre. Most dogfights occur with autopilot doing all of the fancy stuff, with your role reduced to holding down the left-mouse button at key points to score a kill, and occasionally steering the mouse a little or hitting a countermeasures button in response to a massive on-screen prompt.Multiplayer extraordinarily shallow. Spectated an incredibly obvious aim-botter in my second-and-final-ever match. Also strongly suspect that network code is somewhat subpar compared to other games. Avoid like the plague.On the positive side, everything is very pretty, there are many explosions, and the game is very short. Would happily recommend as a diversion between bigger games. (Just stay away from the multiplayer modes.)
Now that the hate train is over this game is actualy pretty good

Ok, ok. I understand that this game gets alot of hate. But I am going to say this now,The multiplayer is not the best, but when you play more, you start  to get into it, and the movement system and the feel of the gun in your hand actually feels very nice and smooth. One thing however is that the animations of the gun and such, are not very fluid and feel VERY clunky. Overall, this game does not really get the hate it gets. It is a fun and unique concept of the CoD franchise. I am NOT a fan of the zombies, however. I could make a huge list of issues and flaws with it, it would just go on and on. It just doesn't make sense and gets boring VERY quickly.  So go on, 7.4/10.

Much like the Overall Reviews, I'm mixed about this game. I really enjoyed the campaign, for a change, and the Specialist difficulty was a lot of fun to do. The YOLO difficulty is next on my list. The Zombie game mode, again for a change, was actually fun. I haven't liked a Zombie game mode in Call of Duty since it first came out for World at War on the 360 (A long time ago)...Now the multiplayer:I have been fortunate enough to not come across any hackers yet, and I've played a few games. Hackers are not as common as people make it out to be. This is honestly a step up from BO 3. The gameplay is much smoother and much easier to play. I think my favorite part about the muliplayer is that they added classic guns, like the M1 garand.As for the overall functionality of the game, it runs fine. The only problem that I came across was that the campaign would not start due to AVG stuff, so I removed AVG and got a REAL antivirus program. Other than that the game is good.I'm gonna recommend it because I enjoyed the campaign a lot, except for the floating around and shooting people (I hate that). I would advise anyone who wants the bundle, however, to get it on a deep sale. Not worth paying $80 for an alright game and a remastered classic. Just isn't.
There's asome right and a lot wrong with IW. The campaign is fantastic. With the exception of Kit Harrington (seriously, did he even try?) the cast is well rounded and has great chemistry. The secondary missions are a refreshing change of pace, and help extend the (really short) storyline missions. The storyline has a few holes, but unless you're really looking for every problem, suspension of disbelief can be maintained. The real problem is when you start paying attention. Every mission completed is completed on the same day as the others. Meaning you can dunk on the entire SDF fleet with the secondaries and clear the story missions and it will only count as a day ingame. I know, I have a spaceship with warp capability. But the idea that both the entire SATO and SDF fleets get wiped out within the same day is just silly. Regardless, the characters are what really keep the story going. I could write a paragraph about each one (with the exception of Salter, the biggest waste of potential in the game) but I've already made the point. They're relatable, they're funny, and they seem genuinely human (robot jokes). In all, I would rank this as one of the better CoD campaigns, and it's a shame that the backlash from the reveal is going to keep people from playing it. I already touched on the secondary missions but I really want to give IW kudos for trying something new with the Jackal missions. For the most part, they work well. There are a couple of segments where it seems that the jackals were shoehorned in and one secondary mission in particular where maintaining flight control is exceedingly difficult. That said, the jackal secondaries were pretty fun and a nice break from the constant groundpounding in the game.The last highlight that this game has is the weapon design. Aesthetically they're pretty much reskinned present-day guns (P90 with a meat tenderizer taped to the front, FMG9 that turns into akimbo, M1 Garand assault/sniper rifle, actual AK47 with a muffler on the front) but mechanically they have their own unique quirks. I replayed a few missions because I wanted to try different weapon combinations and was surprised at the level of replayability from this factor alone.What's wrong... pretty much everything else. The multiplayer isn't anything to write home about and the zombies are equally "meh", held afloat by the inclusion of David Hasselhof. The progression system in MP is just plain awful. Compounded with the apparent lack of anticheat and MP is generally unplayable. I can only  recommend IW if it's on sale and you're getting it for the campaign. If you're getting it for zombies or multiplayer, you can pass on this one and buy Titanfall 2.
I like to play single player campaigns whenever I play new gamesI first saw the reviews and I must say I have to disagree with the majorityMy personal opinion: I like this game. Absolutely loved it.Cutscenes, graphics, new gadgets and gameplay was a welcome new change for me.I enjoyed playing most of MW series, and like most people, MW1 and MW2 are my favorite.Still, I say I enjoyed playing IW because they are always trying something new.It means that they are working hard to give the gamers new experience.While I was playing IW, I really wanted to appreciate the developers for what they did.It's not a cheap rip-off of a franchise. This game deserves better.About the length of the story and pricing: Not long enough? Maybe.If you compare it with open worlds and RPGs, it's very short.Perhaps it is a little overpriced, but I think it's reasonable.All the new features were well integrated with the game itself,and the whole experience leads to immersive gameplay and satisfaction.To be fair, I bought it during Black Friday sales so. I'm happy with it.And yeah the multiplayer mode. I hold my comment on that.First, because I am not very good at it. Second, I don't play it.Verdict: I'd give 8/10 overall for bringing a whole new experience to CoD franchise.

This is a game that even before it came out people had mixed feelings about so it's no surprise that on Steam the user reviews are mixed with just over 50% of people recommending the game.I, seeing the trailers and whatnot, thought it would be awesome as it is a space shooter and as I love si-fi I preordered the Digital Deluxe Edition. This is normally something I would not do but in this case I think it was money well spent.What I aim to do is look at the three game modes (campaign, multiplayer, and zombies) and note what I did and did not like.The single-player experience is fun gameplay-wise. I remember something they said about this game before it came out was that it be reminiscent of classic COD gameplay. And I think that it is. It does remind me of WAW or MW (more so MW) a bit in terms of how the combat plays and how levels are laid out. I will grant however; the game is a little bit (just a little) too cutsence-y for me. Also, and this may be a personal thing, but I was disappointed by the fact that you don't get to drive anything or be a passenger in a cool vehicle like you did in previous games. There was one part that lasted all of 15 seconds where you were a passenger but that was it.The story was good and had some touching moments, except that it was focused around how unbeatable the SDF was but in gameplay you always beat them hands down and they never felt like a threat when you fought them and that made the story seem a little bit silly.There were some cool levels - namely Port Armor which had the civilian terminal area that had super cool futurist design. Also in the level, windows you could shoot out to temporarily depressurize the area made good use of the space theme. Unfortunately, still like that was far and few throughout the game.Not much to say here: pretty similar to the multiplayer of past games so if you like COD multiplayer you'll probably like this. That said, there's not always a lot of players, which Infinity Ward/Activision can't really be blamed for though. They can however, be blamed for the fact that you can only play with Steam players and there is no cross-platform multiplayer at all. Also there is apparently no anti-cheats which, being true, would be pretty poor.I knew it would not be in the game before it came out but also disappointing is the lack of local multiplayer. Just because it's on a computer does not mean some of us would not like to play locally.It is worth mentioning that the maps are really pretty for what that's worth.I've only been able to play this by myself as of yet (lack of local zombies is also disappointing if that didn't go without saying) but it is, again, similar to what was in previous games. Obviously, they added new stuff but it's largely similar. All I can really say is I do enjoy it more or less and the map is cool enough, if way too big for my tastes. It's probably not my favorite iteration but it's neat and I'm sure the coming maps will be pretty cool to play around on.Overall, I would recommend this game if you like shooters and si-fi.

People may think this is ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game,but no.I mean multiplayer sucks♥♥♥♥♥♥but campaign is amazing.R.I.P. BF1
This review starts and ends with one question: are you buying it for the multiplayer?If yes, don't. This game's community is a cesspool. I played one game and encountered children screaming into their microphones, teenagers yelling racial slurs, and people who did not understand what push to talk was (but that really needed it). The multiplayer in this game is categorically inferior to black ops 3, and makes no notable improvements to the call of duty formula. If you're itching for multiplayer, go buy black ops 3 - it's got mod support, anti-cheat and runs better than this game. It's just better in virtually every way.With that aside, the singleplayer and zombies modes in this game are suprisingly good. The campaign is not as good as titanfall 2, but certainly one of the top 3-4 call of duty campaigns I have ever played (and I've played since Call of Duty 2). Actually decent writing and acting makes this a geniunely enjoyable and (if somewhat stiff) emotional campaign.If you want the campaign a LOT, I'd advise you get it on sale for between 40-50USD. If you're also looking to try the zombies mode (which I've heard to be great) with friends, I'd say you could get this game for full price.Overall, it's actually one of the better call of duty games to come out recently. The campaign is full of interesting gameplay and (for once) likable characters. The multiplayer is regretfully flaming hot garbage with a space reskin. The zombies is interesting and fun, if short in content (with only one map). Only get it if you don't mind missing out on this COD's multiplayer gameplay entirely.Performance wise (for those of you who remember ghosts) this game runs quite well. I have a 4770 and a GTX 970 though, so that's to be expected. The game had stuttering problems in cinematics with the audio cutting out and crackling, but these were solved by running it in borderless window. The options menu is well fleshed out with a maximum of 120 FOV and over 4 different AA options, but in general I feel the optimisation is somewhat inferior to black ops 3- adequate, but not impressive. Stay away if you have a slow hard drive that tends to cause frame hitching or stuttering in other games. For those with boot SSDs or who just download all their games to a large SSD, you shouldn't have anything to fear to long as you have something better than say a GTX1050/950 (unfortunately, I have no idea how well this game runs on AMD systems so team red users will have to do their own digging for performance info).
Das Spiel ist besser als ich gedacht habe und macht mega Spass. Aufjedenfall lohnenswert zu kaufen.
Das Spiel ist besser als ich gedacht habe und macht mega Spass. Aufjedenfall lohnenswert zu kaufen.
Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare received a lot of negative feedback ever since the first trailer, which made me sceptical about buying it. In the end, as any die hard Call of Duty fan would do, I pre-ordered it anyway.I have now spent over 70 hours on this game's Singleplayer and Multiplayer and I can safely say that I am very pleased with the game.The Singleplayer has a great storyline and it is overall just really fun to play. The ending was amazing and off the beaten path compared to the endings in all the previous titles which just made it that much greater.The Multiplayer has been nothing but a smooth experience. For once the Multiplayer in a Call of Duty game is working smoothly if you have good internet and a good setup to run the game. There are no hitmarker issues and the balancing is a lot better than the last few entries. The movement system has also been refined for the better. The only Multiplayer issue I have found is that sometimes lobbies can take a while to start, however that is not enough to fault the game.Infinity Ward has done a good job here by trying to learn from the mistakes made by Treyarch in Black Ops 3. I am pleased :)
Playing this as a single player game only. IT WAS AMAZING. Easily the best call of duty singleplay I have played with the combined feeling of Halo, Mass Effect, and Battlefield 2142 all with Call of Duties solid gameplay. While I have a few complaints on the finner points of the plot my only real complaint was that it felt far too short for the kind of rpg systems they put in place around the missions. I got the game on sale, and with that in mind I have no regrets for buying the game for the single player.

Im saying go for it but not for retail cost. If you can find it cheaper on sale or on a steam key site then thats the best option. I personally think the game is better then Bo3. Weapons feel better and sound better too. Maps is where it isn't as great, there's a few good ones but maps like Grounded you might as well quit of the lobby (it's really bad) Variants opposite to what some people will say really aren't that pay to win, there's a few that are OP and should be nerfed but won't be sadly but with the default version of a gun you can easily win a gunfight against any variant, it's a matter of gunskill really. The games anti cheat is crap, utter crap, but if you can record a cheater and post it on the IWcheats reddit the chances of them getting banned are very high. The games campaign is fantastic, one  of the best campaigns i've played to be honest, if there was an option to just purchase the campaign i'd say 100% buy it. I haven't really played zombies much but it's very different from Treyarchs, much more arcade style but still fun. Game optimization is meh on PC, there are some problems but if you have hardwere above the min requirements you'll run the game fine, (warning for Nvidia users, latest drivers at the time of this review make the game run awful)Movement is much more fluid then Bo3's in my opinion also.The game is much more futuristic then any other futuristic cod made before it, theres energy weapons, you're in space, but if setting doesn't really matter to you the game is very fun. depending on how much you pay for it it might not be worth it, you have to ask your self what am i gonna play? just MP? or MP, campaign and zombies? depending on your answer to that you have to consider whats a good amount to spend on the game. Becuase honestly, retail for just MP with an average of 1200-1400 players, isn't worth it.

The "Just Writing A Review To Get The Badge" Review
I'm going to be honest. This game is not as bad as many predicte, but it does have its flaws.Pros:+Campaign is one of the best CoD campaigns in recent years. In my opinion it is better than BO3, AW and Ghost's stories.+People always say that CoD is the same every year, but this jump to space sets it apart from other CoDs+Zombies in spaceland is extremely refreshing and can be quite challenging and therefore rewarding+In depth weapon customisation in zombies and multiplayerCons:-Multiplayer is pretty much the same as BO3 and feels repetitive-Mutiplayer has a lot of hacks/modsIn summary I would only recommend this game if it was on sale or if you only like the Campaign and Zombies modes.
Great campaign.Multiplayer is still decent, although the price is still a bit too high for its content.
One of best COD's I have ever  comparission with BO3 and AW this is 10 times better,because game is optimised a lot better.On MP/Zombies never had FPS drops,only once in SP when i came in space and when big explosion happened.Singleplayer:Good story,on some missions u can chose loud or stealth tactic.Multiplayer:A lot of game mods,a lot of weapons,also prestige rewards are cool,especially classic weapon M1 Garand and Intervantion 2000 sniper(from BO2)Zombies:I played zombies like 2-3 hours,but zombie mod is awesome,and most important better optimised than BO3 oneSummary:Still don't have Season Pass,but i can't wait to buy it :D 10/10 game :D i reccomend this game to all COD and non-COD fans :D
Awesome game. <3 d it
As of right now, you can get MWR and Infinite warfare for $60, and I think that's a great deal.  I might've not gotten it for 80, but $60 for basically 2 games is very good.  MWR feels and looks amazing, and while you can only get into TDM, S&D, FFA, and DOM lobbies, the experience is very good.  I basically just got this for the remastered, and getting infinite warfare was just an added bonus for me.

Simply put, BEST singleplayer experience from a COD game.  Master voice acting, incredible visuals, great story.If you play this for anything, make sure you play the story.As for multiplayer and zombies, I didn't touch em, I don't give a fig for them.
Awesome game. One of the best story in Call of Duty series. Good multiplayer and optimization level. Unreasonable hated.
This game is really cool. I haven't played the campaign yet, but in MP, there's barely any hackers (they need an anti-cheat tho) and they'res barely any annoying weapons in the game. I also thought that ZiS is pretty cool too. It's optimized too.I also got MWR with IW, and it's the laggiest game I've ever seen in my life. It was unoptimized, It'll lag spike so much that it's almost unplayable. I have a GTX 980TI and a i5 4690K and it lags like hell. If you're actually expecting to play this game I would wait until they optimize it.
The first COD game that I have played right through for over 6 years in single player.Pros: Great single player game very reminiscent of Wing Commander which made it great fun.Cons: Too bloody short! Single player can be completed in less than 9 hours with all side missions completed & viewing credits!Multi player match making is a joke, level 1 verses 40 or 50+! Oh come-on.  Certainly not worth the £40 asking price but if you can get it for at least half that price it’ll be worth it for the single player game, just!COD definitely needs a couple of years break.

Solid game.
Having for the game working which is turning off AVG to be able to play which i personally think shouldn't be the case. After playing an hour into single player I can honestly say that I am enjoying the game and I would recommend it, the graphics are really nice and maxed out I am getting between 70fps to 120fps. I haven't played online yet but when I played the beta I didn't like it but I'm hoping I do. The game has potential if they fix the FPS drop and being able to play without disabling AVG.I can understand why people moan about the game being futuristic but that's how it will probably be in the future. If they just brought games out of the same era then people would still moan.I'm happy with the game now I've got it working and I initally thought I wouldn't be and I'm really impressed by the graphics.
I am a huge fan of Call of Duty zombies, I have been ever since the game mode first came out! This one offers a similar spin as to what Black Ops 2 expansions did, more exploration and progressive, rather than hold out and survive. Campaign is okay, nothing really gripping. Its a pretty linear and obvious story, nothing much to say about to in my opinion. The multiplayer is pretty much the same as it is in every game. They just tack on one more game mechanic at a time. This one I have noticed the skill gap makes a HUGE difference. There have always been kids that can get the end kill-streak no problem, but I am noticing more that most games go by with almost no one getting a 5 kill streak or higher, and if they do they are getting all thier killstreaks. Run-And-Gun-No-Think-Fun. If thats what you want, get it.
Most fun I've had since FEAR Combat days' Most people won't take the time to get there mouse settings right. Thats ok' FEED ME THOSE KILLS!!!9/10
Damn son
This is my first review because I feel like I need to say somerthing about my experiece in the multiplayer aspect of this game.  I was not going to buy this game due to some of the reviews that said that this game is pretty much like BO3 which I really did not like at all because of how the weapons and the movement felt.  I bought this game on sale becaue I was only interested in the MW4R and decided not to wait for stand alone because it might be months before they release it by itself. I decided to take a chance on this  and if I did not like it, I would return it.  After playing MW4R for quite a bit and loving it, I decided to install IW and I was getting myself ready to be disappointed.  But  I was pleasantly suprised that the multiplayer is a lot more fun and feels a lot better to me in every way than BO3 did.  The movement is a bit slower and more methodical and has weight to it and when you pick up guns they feel different from each other and they feel right when you shoot them.  There is power and weight to weapons that I did not feel with BO3.  Overall I am glad I bought this game as I will be playing MP in IW a lot more than I did BO3.  So if you are like me and did not care for B03, I would suggest you try it and you might be very suprised on how much better it is.  But if you liked B03 than this might go either way.
Another year, another call of duty. This one has a decent campaign and the same old multiplayer format with some slight variations.Specs: GTX 1080 FE, i7 4790k, 16GB RamPerformance wise, the game runs fine. It has an FPS lock at 90 in multiplayer which is mildly annoying but the 1080 keeps everything at 90 with no frame drops during gameplay at max settings. I'd like to see this FPS lock removed but I doubt we'll ever see something good like that from the CoD team.People seem to get a little angry anytime a new CoD comes out and immediately want to bash it as the worst game ever when in reality it's not a bad game. Granted, it's not the best thing ever and if the team would spend more time on one game rather than trying to ship one out every year the quality could be better, but overall it's not a terrible game. Don't expect a reimaging of the game industry like Half-Life when playing it.

Call of Duty Infinite Warfare is good in some areas and horrible in othersCampain is the best one we had since Modern Warfare, which is easy to say because I can play both. It is actually good. I cared about what I was doing a lot more than the past COD. The dogfighting is amazing and so are the missions variety. Honestly that is one of the reasons you should buy the game. Multi-player is completely♥♥♥♥♥♥ It is exactly the same from black ops 3. All the cool things they did in the campain are not in this mode. The time to kill is very low to the point every gun is the same. Also this mode feels more pay to win here than before. Now the only good thing this mode has is player progression and player customization. Don't buy the game for this modeZombies was always my favorite mode. Here they helped remover some of the annoying things from the mode. Like how when you die you lose all your guns; if you have enough points you can retrieve them. So this mode is wroth buying.Few other good things about the game is you can see better graphics, easily. Also the guns are familier to modern warfare. As soon as i used one I can tell which one mimics the M4A1 and the AK47. Guns here are more fun to use. Downside is the feeling of more payed to win and the♥♥♥♥♥♥Multi-Player. I got bored after one day and the split user base from Xbox means only one mode most of the time. The game does earn the 60 dollars and barely earns the 80 dollar edition with remastered, that is a good remake. Good old modern warfare with better graphics. I recommend this game if you want a good single player exp, or a fan of zombies. Not for the multi-player. I do suggest get the 80 dollar version if you want a solid shooter with boots on the ground. The game actually did really well in a lot of areas but did the same in the bad. Hope this review helps.

I bought it via♥♥♥♥♥on sale (my mistake, now I don't get to play modern warfare remastered) and just wanted to play the campaign. Yes I bought COD for the campaign.As basic as the campaign was, I enjoyed it. It didn't drag on, I casually beat it in a few days and enjoyed pretty much all of it. E3N is a very welcome addition. You kind of wish there was a bit more depth to the campaign, but then again, it wouldn't be COD. It's on rails, it's like a movie and I enjoyed it.Multiplayer is reasonably fun too. I kind of wish it didn't have the wall running and boost jumping (that's why I double regret not having mw remastered), but it's enjoyable. Fast pace, casual gameplay. I'm a long time CS player and I gotta say, this is fun... If you ever get into a lobby that is, queue(I'm in Latvia). Also, being level 1-2-3 and matching people who have Prestige is... Challenging.TL;DR: Bought it for the campaign, didn't expect much, enjoyed it.
I really don't wanna give this a positive rating. It's honestly not that great. There's a whole lot wrong with this game, so take my review with a grain of salt.This game is really clunky, The multiplayer isn't great, and the campaign feels pretty bad. But there are 2 things that cause me to give this a positive review: Zombies and Modern Warfare: Remastered.The zombies mode is great. I am someone who has played just a TON of zombies since Black Ops 1, and I've loved the mode, but I was so dissatisfied with Black Ops 2 it's really great to play the Infinite Warfare zombies because of the new rank system, as well as the loadout system that makes playing zombies different as you level up and get better guns. There's more of an incentive for me to play and I love being able to unlock new things for the weapons. This mode also brings back the complexity of the Tranzit mode but without having to deal with everything you hated about Tranzit.Modern Warfare: Remastered is amazing. Maybe because It's Modern Warfare released again, but their remastery was so good and the multiplayer AND campaign are just so enjoyable, I love being able to play all over agian because it's all so smooth and great,5.1/10This game is very mediocre but it's just barely holding on to my heart. By .1 pointsThanks For Reading!-Joe "Bonzaijoe"

Contextual disclosure: I’m not multiplayer gamer, and I’m equally fan of SF as history.Must admit I was under strong influence of hate hype prior to CoD:IW launch. To put it mildly I was skeptical of another “future warfare” instalment of the game. At the same time, I was curious to try it and see why so many gave it hard time.After finishing presumably half of the campaign I can say this game is awesome! First, this is by far the best optimized DirectX 11 game, able to produce this level of graphic fidelity. Graphics engineers at development team, have created engine that’s masterpiece. Design and art guys have also done superb job. This is beautifully designed and detailed game-world.Obviously, equally important part is gameplay mechanic. Given the fact that this game “parents” are Infinity Ward and Raven Software, it’s no wonder that gameplay mechanic is second to none. Just the other day I was thinking how cool were Raven games like Star Trek: Voyager – Elite Force, Quake 4, Singularity… these guys simply don’t have bad game.To conclude, this is awesome game! Whoever loves SF militaristic operas, shows like Battlestar Galactica, or more recent Expanse, will enjoy this game. You don’t even need over-expensive PC hardware for it. It looks gorgeously and run great on much more affordable components.With no doubt, this is the best CoD game since CoD: Modern Warfare

Call of Duty gets a lot of hate.  Some of it justified, a lot of it not.'COD is always the same every year'  they change the game and suddenly 'What happened to boots on ground gameplay?'People just don't know what they want.This review is based on the MP part of the game as I'm yet to play the SP or really put anytime into Zombies mode.The movement system has been refined from AW and BO3 and it's the best yet; strafe sliding? Yep, about time.COD is all about the gunplay and while this year's game has less than usual, the prototypes make up for this and then some.Player numbers are currently pretty low for a COD title (BO3 has more players, but it has amazing mod tools to be fair) however if you're in Europe you'll have no issues getting a game, if you like TDM which most of the player base appears to.Recommended.
This is a review based solely on the Multiplayer and Zombies gamemode. Keep in mind this is mostly my opinion.Starting with multiplayer i'm writing this as of just hitting prestige 1 and so far i'm really enjoying.The movement it pretty much the same as Blops3 with minor changes. Guns feel solid and overall feel different. I will say there is a lack of guns overall to choose from but getting into variants you get little changes to try keep guns you use all the time feeling fresh. Sadly some variants of guns give you a rather minor advantage over players without such choice in weaponary. This doesn't bother me but may bother you, to each their own. The rigs are quite different from one another but don't bring much new to the table from Blops3 and kinda just does little twists to what you remember. Same thing with scorestreaks, you'll remember most of them. The maps are alright, some feel just thrown together? Biggest problem with the multiplayer at the moment is dual wield. People seem to run around using dual wield pistols and they kills so quick you don't know what even happened. Once that gets fixed, if it ever does, then the guns are pretty balanced overall. As for the lack of anti-cheat I haven't found any hackers yet. The forums are full of people complaining but i'm yet to see one for myself. Final result 8/10.Now for the zombies. As of right not there is only one map being Zombies in Spaceland which isn't that bad. The size of the map is pretty big and actually overwhelmed me at first. The Fate and Fortune cards work the same as the candy from Blops3. Fate cards you get from leveling up in the zombies gamemode and Fortune being cards you get out of the zombie crates which are one time use kind of things. Pack-a-punch machine still works the same but activating it is different. Easter eggs on this map are pretty crazy and a guide was much needed for me as working it out for myself seemed too difficult. Being able to customize guns is quite nice though, keeps me experimenting with different attachments and such. So far a great edition to an already great gamemode. Final result 8.5/10Quick note being the game runs fine on my computer at 60fps 1080p no frame drops ot stutters to be seen. Your experience may vary of course. Games great and I hope more people come join the multiplayer as the community is pretty small being only 5k players at peak. If you feel I missed anything or have any questions feel free to comment and ask. Thanks for reading.

rankkaa
I don't agree with the general consensus that Modern Warfare has the best Call of Duty campaign. In my opinion, that spot goes to Infinite Warfare. The game takes place in the near future, but it's tackled so well. It's believable, unlike the future depicted in Black ops 3, which seems like a bullcrap from the beginning. What I find the most amazing about this CoD though is the character development. Each character is given something. No over the top death scenes like in the previous entries, which were supposed to make you care for someone at the last moment. Deaths of your allies here are meaningful and executed well. Even for it's shorter game length, the game managed to develop almost every character to the point you feel their deaths. The overall story is good, nothing completely mind-blowing, but it works well in the overall scheme. Main villain is hardly in the game, but I think it worked better, than some of the omnipresent villains from the past entries. This could have been a great start of a sub-series to the CoD franchise, were the general fanbase not people who only care for multiplayer/battle royale games. The gameplay mechanics are what you'd expect from your typical CoD game. Though the gunplay feels satisfying, given the variety of ballistic and energy based weapons. There's also space combat, which can be clunky at times, but overall works and looks fine. There are also side missions, yes, side missions in a Call of Duty game. They work as a sort of progression for your character, each giving you some kind of upgrade, either to your character or to your arsenal. I won't talk about the zombie mode and multiplayer here, because IW's campaign towers over these two modes in a spectacular manner. To be quite honest and to sum this up, I think that Call of Duty Infinite Warfare is one of the best Sci-fi FPS games out there. (Yes, I know I'm making this "review" 2 years after the launch.)
Bought this for Cod Remastered and Zombies, but I didn't regret the game itself. even though I am not that into futuristic shooters, both this and black ops 3 was a fun game to play.

I've played a good 45 hours of this game and tried every inch of this game and really enjoyed it and dont' believe in the "hate" every is giving it. Let me break it down.**Campaign *Spoilers**Read With Caution*** - This has to be my 3rd favorite campaign Call of Duty created, not because of how it played out, but the small meanings behind it. After playing the entire thing and currently working on finishing it in Veteran, I realized at the end of it that most of the previous Call of Duty games didn't have: Casualties of War. Sure in the previous games you had characters in the game you know and love die off, but not as much as this game. It really showed that in true warfare, you can make as many friends as you want, but in the end, they might no longer be there. The end reminded me of our soldiers fighting out there now for our safety. - Regarding that note, the Campaign played out real nice. In concluded very well, no major loose ends, chances of a sequel? Not Likely. From the mission select screen there are about 30ish missions. I enjoyed the time spent on the details that most players don't see (During feet week it felt as if each NPC had their own personality). It felt very similar to the Ghosts campaign, which should be obvious since its the same dev team. I really enjoyed the Ghosts story and this one was just as good. I liked how weapons were unlocked by your player "scanning" weapons instead of them just instantly unlocked. The Jackal mission were very exciting as well. I expected the controls for the Jackal to feel weird, but it played out nice compared to if your boots on the ground.  - Lastly the whole boosting and jumping around the map, I didn't really do much. Of couse I'll do them here and there when needed, but overall, the campaign really had your feet drilled to the ground (excluding the zero g missions).**Multiplayer**\ - This can go both ways with some people, but I'll stick with my thoughts and opinions since I tried the MP myself. I'm about halfway through reaching max level (55), and it feels very smooth. The jump boosting and all that feels more toned down than Black Ops 3. You're mostly on the ground. I've tried every weapon class and they all feel great, especially the snipers. I'm not a pro and I'm your casual sniper that takes "quick scoping" into 2nd account then first. The game felt like a mix between Ghosts and Black Ops 3, which I think is a nice feel. The keys and weapon crates aren't entirely bad, I do enjoy sharing the keys between zombies and MP  because it helps me grind out both level modes. - Sure they're are bugs, glitches, and other nonsense that needs to be fixed, but hey, that's how newly released games are. In time they will be fixed, and it be just better than before. - The combat rigs don't feel overpowered either. I, as an average player, usually get my rig at max twice a game on TDM. So, on average, players aren't relying a lot on their rigs to get them kills. **Zombies** - Before I get into this. I REALLY wanted extinction to return just because it was a different flow in the franchise. I'm hoping they don't do a zombies every year because if so, they might run the zombies idea dry as well. So I expected extinction, but got zombies instead. I'll take it for now. - Zombies feels really great. I enjoy small things that 3arc didn't do or didn't find necessary. Things like smaller hitboxes, so its easier to run around zombies, custom melee animations, 5 perk held at a time instead 4. It felt really nice. The story is intriguing as well. I'm still trying to understand why a directior would put props and power ups in his show if he didn't want our actors to use it, but oh well. It felt easier to reach higher rounds, (some might think this is bad, but its helpful for  people learning to play or players getting better). The "quest" items were not forced on the player like our traditional zombies. We could easily play the game without touching a single item in our inventory. The bank is very useful, (especiallly me since I'm very supportive in public matches.) Weapon kits are nice and the Fate and Fortune cares are just as good. They dont' feel overpowered, but are very useful when needed. - One thing I'm a bit off of is the public matchmaking. I think it be troublesome in the future to have to wait for 4 players just to start a match.**End Note** - Campaign: Highly recommend, great story, and a cool calling card if you complete it. - Multiplayer: I think it's fun, I'm enjoying it better than the last two years of cod mp(BO3 & AW) - Zombies: Still wanted extinction, but it's worth playing as well.

zombies is done great. mp is fast pasted servers need tuning hackers need to be kicked. you can feel activision corprate hand unfornately with some of the things missing like leaderboard emblem creator lack of anti cheat. the single player is enjoyable
I think this game is great I enjoy playing with mp and really enjoy zombies.MP: 7/10Zombie: 9/10I runs great on my 1060 just hate the fps lock.
Infinite Warfare put to rest my concerns that (a) IW are just going to keep releasing the same fan-service games and (b) that they were going to mess up the sci-fi aspects of a war game set in the far future. In my opinion, neither of these turned out to be true.I enjoy CoD's multiplayer, but I don't have the time it takes to really get into it, so my focus in all of the Call of Duty games has been the single player story-driven experience. It's this single player experience where I feel Infinity Ward has always excelled far beyond both Treyarch and Sledgehammer, and achieved a truly cinematic gameplay experience which is heavily polished in every aspect. This formula is perfected even further with Infinite Warfare.The game's a shooter--so let's focus on what's important first. Performance is outstanding, even with high settings and on a computer that hasn't been updated in a couple of years. The gunplay feels great--like all good CoD games, the weapons feel weighty and the aiming feels precise. Yes, the game suffers from a little bit of a "whack-a-mole" feel at times, but this is more noticeable in multiplayer in my opinion. That's because of the next aspect I'll get into.The way the story plays out is incredible. Like the best blockbuster movies, you're ushered through a perfect ebb and flow of action in a very diverse story involving characters you'll actually find yourself caring about. Tired of recent stories all involving warring nations in familiar territory? Not here. Every mission has you doing something different, and the game introduces many new concepts thanks to how far in the future it's set, not the least of which are huge spaceships, dogfighting missions, and zero-G missions. I didn't get bored of shooting the same types of people (and machines) again and again because something different was always going on. Every single aspect of the single player experience--from the graphics, to the gameplay, to the voice acting, to the quality of the sound effects, to the soundtrack--each of those aspects were polished to such a degree that makes many other games look like betas even after years of patching.Back with the first Modern Warfare title, Infinity Ward gave us the secret to their new formula--variety. Infinite Warfare carries the torch of this formula to a much higher degree than I was expecting, without sacrificing any of the great core gameplay that made CoD a success in the first place.Everybody gets some aspect of a CoD game wrong. This seems to be the closest anyone has come since CoD4 to getting all of the aspects just right in a way that feels fresh again. I was worried about Infinity Ward after losing many of their core team and needing to bring in Sledgehammer to help them finish MW3. I'm not worried about Infinity Ward anymore. Now, I just can't wait for the next game in the Infinite Warfare series (Please let there be one!)Additional note: I also got the version which includes Modern Warfare Remastered. Again I haven't spent much time in multiplayer, but the single player experience is just like I remember, but better! Raven did a great job updating the game to feel more modern without ruining any of what makes me replay that story at least once a year or so.
great by overallfar better than RPG storylinevast way to play in zombiesF2P friendly MPgrab it if you are sci fi and lore loverleave it if you are Boots on ground maniac..9/10 for them (10/10 if they fixed graphics compability)

its not as bad as ppl say it is i like it its fun it just need a few updates to get it better
MOUSE ACCELERATION ISSUES HAVE BEEN FIXED- PC PORT RUNS GREAT, LOOKS GREAT OTHER THAN 91 FPS CAP IN MP. Overall:Campaign 7/10Multiplayer 6/10Zombies 9/10The Campaign is a fun adventure through space with believable chararacters. There are neat side quests and beautiful space scapes. It really is quite neat.  There are some exceptions for the characters. The robot character E3N is more human than he should be in my opinion, he seems way too aware of emotion to possibly be a robot.Also the main villain actually kind of sucks. Normally CoD villains are actually pretty alright but this guy is some cliche over the top james bond villain with like 5 minutes of screen time throughout the whole campaign (his introduction is cool though). "Freedom has no place in this solar system" according to our villain. just a little ham fisted. Also the whole plot (read: war) takes place in a single day. It annoyed me so much where they literally say "We lost a lot of people this morning, time to finish this". Those were some of the major stuff that stood out, other than that the campaign is actually a fun one to play through clocking for me at a solid 12 hours to do everything. Atleast it wasn't the trash fire of black ops 3 campaign.MULTIPLAYERMultiplayer is a stiffer version of black ops 3 with maps that are even more cramped. While guns like the NV4 are fun to shoot and there is that inevitable euphoria that comes with the CoD grind there isn't anything that sets this title a bar ahead of black ops 3 in anyway other than specialist characters looking like soldiers and not heroes. If you enjoy CoD and played black ops 3 to death you might as well pick this up because it's a whole new grind, otherwise if you haven't played a CoD in a while pick up black ops 3 with it's mod support and smoother movement and better map deisng for this movement system (imo).ZOMBIESNow this I enjoy whole heartedly. It's back to simple, stupid fun like the old zombies. Many complained about zombies starting to center too much around quests and less about... zombies. Well this so far has struck a perfect middle ground. There are a bunch of quests to do but at no point do you feel obligated to do them and they certainly aren't a chore to do unlike how it could get in late black ops 2/ black ops 3. You kill zombies in this ludicrious 80s envrionment (who knows where the next map will go) with great music in the background and David Hasselhoff watching your back. The map is designed terrifically and is completely unique. If you're a fan of old school zombies i would suggest this.

Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare ReviewSo I felt like doing a review on this game as a few people I've met and discussed the COD games totally didn't know about how the story can suck you in but only if you are dedicated toward understanding the story, do the missions, and start to see an attachment to the characters within the game.Singleplayer Story:So when the game first starts up and you begin the storyline for COD: IW, I didn't think to much toward what I was doing or who the characters are when you first enter the game. Of course, new characters are introduced but I still wanted to know a little more on what was going on in the new world of COD IW. After a few missions, you start to understand the circumstances and then what you have to do within the game. I chose to take on each and every mission which better explained and also made the player understand the characters along with becoming attached. The characters are enjoyable, can be funny, but shows a relationship between each character. The only issue I had with the storyline was that it was too short. I literally beat the game with all missions completed in under 4 hours. Wish there were more to it but I guess it's time for me to choose the difficulty "veteran" to have a little more gameplay. Multiplayer:Is there anything to say about this as it does feel like the last COD but does have new weapons, rigs, teams, etc. Maps are decent, still the run-and-gun whoever hits the trigger first wins but still is fun in it's own way. Zombies have been improved and totally LOVE IT!!! Going back to the 80's was a great idea but versing clowns just scare me in my dreams so the game can haunt you for a while if you don't like clowns haha!Overall:I'd say if you are a hardcore COD fan, definitely go for this game. If you just want to go for the storyline, then I'd advise to wait for the price to go down since the storyline can be beaten in 4 hours or less. I'd recommend this game for Zombie and multiplayer players as those modes are pretty fun to play!Oh and not only that, purchasing the 100$ COD IW comes with the Modern Warfare Remaster which is a great deal as you get the Season Pass and you then go back to the past :).

I love this game. I really find it fun to play. Of course I can ULTRA it on my ROG SWIFT PG348Q and since this game is a lot about graphics and is pretty hard to run for "normal" machines, I might be a bit â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ed about it. Tried fifteen minutes of this game, and on the basis of having played quite a bit of black ops III, as well as finishing a number of other games in this franchise, I feel I must post what I will try to make an even-handed review, I may update this as I play more, but so far I can say with confidence, the following:1) This game does feel clunky; I would agree with what many people have written here on the basis of the fact that the thrusters/jetpack jump does not seem to function as smoothly as it did in BO3. When your character goes to jump, the movement jerks around a little more than it should and the timing seems off when you do things like jumping from platform to platform, or even unrealated movements such as adjusting aim down the sights, or ducking/going prone. Whilst the buggy movement, does not in itself, render the game unplayable in my opinion, or a waste of money; it certainly takes away from the experience in a genre where I become reliant on being able to react split second to what is on the screen. Not to mention, killing immersion. Definite minus on that, but I feel with time, the devs can and should be able to patch this, in fact, I believe BO3 had a similar issue that was also later fixed. Furthermore, in my humble opinion, CS:GO and Medal of Honor: Frontline are both older FPS/Tactical games, and their mechanics are, to me, less clunky, and in some ways probably more realistic simply because of this, despite their lack of finesse and finer detail (ie: "realism" as some like to call it). In short, stop focusing on more things your avatar can do, and start trying to make the avatar do what he already does; properly. That is where, I believe, the devs went wrong here. 2) I cannot vouch for the storyline yet, but all I can say from my own experience on this is that the last two or three, or even four COD games have had the same or similar type of storyline; I was expecting a futuristic repeat, and that is sort of what I got. Though, I will admit, I did hold out hope for a new storyline, and I think a nice attempt has been made here, thus far. Please, if you buy this, judge it on its own merits, and not that of other games. This is a cod remake intended for COD fans in my opinion, if you do like other games like Titanfall or whatnot, then yes, you will probably be dissapointed on this front, as the storyline repeats, much like previous CODs. 3) Overall, I would say this game is worth a try, but maybe at half the price it's at, if not simply free. There is definitely something to be said about the developers perhaps needing to have considered keeping this at a free-to-try beta until they fixed the glaring issues so many have spoken of, that really do take away from the COD experience. I personally am a little peeved to have been forced to pay around $90AUD for a half-finished product that was not even released as fully updated or stable. I will finish this point by only saying this: I hope to GOD someone decides to patch this properly, as the game has potential, and it is sad to see it going down the drain because of things, that in my experience are simply performance issues, rather than completely to do with the game content itself.Conclusion: Good game, solid concept, but please, please.. work on it more, there are many things that take away from the game, that could probably be adressed fairly quickly and easily. As a COD fan, it does hurt me to have to not reccommend this game simply because it is clunky and overpriced for what you are getting. As a game, is it bad? No, it's pretty damn decent, for what I'd expect from COD games. Is this bad as a paid-for product? Yes, not worth it to me, when you pay for what feels like a half-finished, rushed product that could probably have used more time on the workbench before being put into the hands of the paying public. I will still give the game a thumbs up, but only because I would like to see this product worked on more, before providing a final verdict.

Having just completed the story mode I have to say that it's a return to form for the COD franchise. Some people have complained that it is just another formulaic re-run of all COD games but while that is true to a certain extent, isn't that why we play the games? Familiarity is comforting and feels nostalgic but where Infinte Warfare stands out is when the massive set pieces play out on such a grand scale you can't help but sit back and admire them. The addition of flying through space and getting down and dirty in dogfights is excellent. One thing the discerners will be unable to negatize is the sheer non-stop pace of the story, which is breathless and makes you feel the pressure of the characters to get the job done. While it will always be an on rails shooter I thank the developers for sticking to what the majority of gamers want.... frantic shooter pacing, great set pieces, a cracking storyline and a few hours of sheer fun. Many thanks to the COD team and keep on entertaining us!

If this is you then maybe it's time you change your genre of game and go play games that you haven't played in the last 10+ years.If you complain about this game and you have say 5 years of gaming experience then i'd presume your views are tainted with the perception of everyone else, Year after year since Black Ops 2 came out people hate that it isn't the same as MW2 and yet COD titles are still the biggest selling franchise of FPS games to date. It has been a long time since I could recommend a Call of Duty game based solely on its campaign but Infinite Warfare breaks the trend. The campaign is invigorating. It mixes the space setting with the brisk and controlled shooting action for which the series is known. There is good diversity across the primary missions as players jump from Earth's moon to Saturn's moon for equally amazing sequences. If only the campaign was longer. Zombies mode is a lot of fun; tumbling through a theme park, turning on show rides that decimate undead hordes, is a good way to kill time. Multiplayer is probably the weakest link, despite it being fairly close to the action from last year. Maps get better in time but nagging online issues, waning populations, and weapon variants negate some of the fun. Nevertheless, Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare will provide a varied and precise journey through our Solar System in one of the most enthralling campaigns in the franchise so far.
It has been a long time since I could recommend a Call of Duty game based solely on its campaign but Infinite Warfare breaks the trend. The campaign is invigorating. It mixes the space setting with the brisk and controlled shooting action for which the series is known. There is good diversity across the primary missions as players jump from Earth's moon to Saturn's moon for equally amazing sequences. If only the campaign was longer. Zombies mode is a lot of fun; tumbling through a theme park, turning on show rides that decimate undead hordes, is a good way to kill time. Multiplayer is probably the weakest link, despite it being fairly close to the action from last year. Maps get better in time but nagging online issues, waning populations, and weapon variants negate some of the fun. Nevertheless, Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare will provide a varied and precise journey through our Solar System in one of the most enthralling campaigns in the franchise so far.

***** 5 Star Rating, Very under rated gameOnly bad point, not enough players and too many hackers :)
Ok dont get all the fuss, this game is fun.  I really enjoy it, now dont get me wrong, it took a min. for me to like it.This game is getting a bad rap for sure, it will grow on you if you give it a chance. I know several people that have been haters of this game from the get go, but once they played it for a bit, they really enjoy it and changed their stance on it.The gameplay is faster than say Advanced Warfare, and faster than BO3.  I like that.  My only real gripes about the game is, the arrow keys on the keyboard, if used for movement, will get stuck and you have to double tap the key in order to get it to move again.  Now if you have a keyboard that allows you to change the bind's of the keys, you can bind the arrow keys to the WADS keys and it works fine.  Only drawback from that is, now you cant scroll side to side while in lobby to check out the other players stats and character selections, unless you bind the arrow keys to something else, because that uses the arrow keys for movement while in lobby.The other one is the fps lock at the 91.  wow really.... After the update, it has gotten lots smoother.  So give it a try, you will change your mind, and you will end up putting in some hours.  Im sure as the updates keep coming other things will change, but as for now, i like it.Single player is just ok in my book, but it still kept me interested, and not bored.Dont understand all the hate this game is generating, and how some people are leaving negative reviews, because they didnt like the lobby, or the settings layout.
